reviews.review: This is a magnificent Basilica. A Must See.. Construction began in 435AD. There is a security check that one is subjected to. Depending on the crowds, the queue may be long. But do not be disheartened. It moves fairly quickly. It is within walking distance of the Colosseum and located in San Vito. The Hop-on-Hop-off bus also stops here.
A glorious Sunday mass. A sincerely beautiful church, the first in the city, with a very special social outreach program for the poor and disabled in Trastevere.

Spectactular Papal Basilica. Santa Maria Maggiore is a spectactular church. Pope Francis said his first mass here after becoming Pope. The church was started in 432 and took 1300 years to complete. The church has many side alters where mass is said in a different language. There are also signs posted for confessions in many different languages.Each of the side alters is different and beautiful. Be sure to notice the mosaics. They are made of thousands of small pieces. Go early because a line forms to go through the security check point.

Interesting and worth a visit. This church is worth the visit as it is a work of art and craftsmanship. There is so much to observe from an impressive entrance, gilded ceilings, marble floors/columns, array of highly crafted statues and artworks. This is a functional church with smaller individualised chapels along the side with mass services taking place in several different langues. As there is just so much to take in a guided tour is recommended to get the full impact of the history of what is deemed the second largest church in Rome.

Basilica do Sante Maria Maggiore. Another of the breathtaking churches in Rome. There doesn't seem to be as much tourism hype concerning this church but I'm glad I didn't miss it. We took a tour through this Basilica and it was well worth the time and money. You won't be disappointed.

In Awe of Gold. I've been to Rome 3 times and I finally got to see the Santa Maria! Wear appropriate clothing as long as its knee length or longer its respectful. The building itself isn't huge but there is so much to see inside, the gold intricate ceilings, dazzling yellow light spilling in from the windows and small alcoves adorned with mosaics and craftsmanship. Just go and see this - sit on the pews and drink in the surroundings.

This is the second largest church in Rome and is worth a visit.. This large church is worth a visit for its imposing frontage, gilded ceilings, chapels and works of art. It feels more like a church that is being used and services in several languages were going on while we were there.
One of my very favorite Churches I visited. The story behind this Church is amazing. The Miracle of Snow dream, the the Holy Crib, kneeling Pope Pius statue, etc...all just beyond imagination

Go early before crowds. The first day we passed by about 10am and the queue was huge, the next day at 8am, we walked straight in.While not as grand as St Peters Basilica, it is a very interesting church, as was impressed that the marble steps in part, were worn down by countless footsteps over the years. As we were early, we had the place almost to ourselves.

Impressive church. We arrived just as some religious stuff was being done, so the air was thick with incense [which did hide the odour of some of the parishioners.The church was impressively gaudy, in just thye way that C of E churches aren't. worth a short visit,

Impressive church. We arrived just as some religious stuff was being done, so the air was thick with incense [which did hide the odour of some of the parishioners.
The church was impressively gaudy, in just thye way that C of E churches aren't. worth a short visit,

Most amazing! . I have toured many chapels, churches and basilicas in Rome - Maggiore is by far the most impressive of the major basilicas. Although it attracts a LOT of visitors, it always seems to offer peace and wonderment at every visit. After exploring the various chapels, make sure to sit for a while and just consume the atmosphere.

A must see if you love Historical Churches. We had the opportunity to sit through a beautiful Byzantine Mass spoken and sung in Latin - it was amazing. This is a very peaceful and obviously true community Catholic Church. It's a must see!

The Second Best. This basilica is only rivaled by St Peter's Basilica in the Vatican.
There are over 900 churches in Rome. This should be high on your list to visit.

Absolutely stunning cathedral. As cathedrals go this is up there with the best. I was overwhelmed by its beauty and size. There was a line up to go through security, but if you time it right the line won't be too long, but anyway it's worth the wait. Put it on the "must see" list

Fantastic tour. We walked around the Basilica on our own, as we just stumbled across St Mary Major. Once we had walked around the Church we went down to the museum, where the gentleman offered us the tour option. It was a great tour, Emanuel the guide was fantastic, if you take the tour you are able to go up on to the balcony to see the amazing mosaic. You also get to see the papal halls and hear about the rich and important history of the church. The tour cost about €5 and I would say it's the best money we spent. The church ceiling is covered with all of the first gold bought back from the Americas, it really is a sight to see. I can't rate this church and tour highly enough!!!

Amazing place to pray. Go there on Sunday and attend one of the most beautiful mass service.The artwork and ambience are amazing.There is a very good reason why this is one of the four major churches in Rome, including St. Peter's Basilica.

Stunning and very interesting. Would recommend a visit. Spectacular and very interesting. Would recommend buying the guide book to refer to as you walk round. It was about 5 euros and has great photos
Magnificent. My favorite church in Rome, see the underground it is amazing. And of course the tomb of Bernini right by the alter.

Very impressive; Well worth the trip. One of the most impressive basilicas in Rome. Being an Ex-Territory of the Vatican, prepare for meticulous security checks. We visited during a large communal prayer of a group from Germany, and the choir was heavenly. The art and architecture are magnificent. we had to take a special trip to get there in the rain, but it was well worth it!!
Pretty. It was such a beatiful place. We enjoyed our visit and seeing all the amazing detail, you can't see things like this anywhere else but Italy
Amazing!. Although the line in security check is long and place was crowded, the basilica is totally beautiful inside!

Beautiful church.. We walked from our hotel to the Basilica. This is one of the Papal churches. It has a magnificent entry into the church. Had some very nice side chapels. This is such a large church that you cannot take a picture of the outside of the church. Worth seeing.

Ancient Mosaics. One of the holy doors for the Year of Mercy. Ancient mosaics (from 5th century) visible. Facade dates from 18th century and it has a 14th century bell tower. Wonderful to just sit silently for a while.

Fantastic. Free entry and minimum queue to get in.
Well worth a visit as the interior is amazing. I could stop looking at the ceiling that must be almost unique in design.

Yer another treat in Rome. There are just so many places to see in Rome but I wouldn't miss this one. The art and sculpture is amazing and the huge hall has a stunning effect. You gotta see this if you staying longer a couple of days !!

Impressive. The church is beautiful and impressive. Maybe it's best if you actually go to the evening service there, the acoustic is mind blowing. The church is always open, if you see a closed entrance it means you need to go on the other side (the actual entrance is not on the side with the small park in front of it).

Huge church. While I was in there, I heard someone say that it was equal to St Peters. I didn't think that was true, but it certainly is one of the biggies in terms of churches and decoration. It's easy to walk to from Termini and St Peter in Chains is quite close and (surprisingly for Italy) well signposted from there.

Beautiful!. We arrived here quite late in the day and there was no queue, we walked straight in after we passed security. The basilica is absolutely beautiful. The ceiling is incredible to look at. There are relics of the Holy crib under the high altar which was incredible.Would definately love to return to take some more time here and take it all in

Beautiful . One of the 4 Papal Basilicas in Rome. Didn't set iut to visit it, but it was a part of my tour package .... I'm sooooo glad it was. An absolutely beautiful Basilica, with amazing artistry on display from top to bottom. And one of the most publicly used Basilicas...so had a real homely feel.

Abundance. The church is an excellent specimen of Renaissance art and architecture. Yet, it's very crowded and queues in front of security (yes, they have it here now too) can be tedious due to the ruthlessness of pilgrim groups.
Beautiful. Another magnificent basilica in Europe, with very impressive architecture. Smooth entrance procedure.
Stunning. We spent several hours here and were absolutely amazed at the quality of work and how well it's survived the centuries

Authentic and beautiful church. Our hotel was across the street from this beautiful basilica, but we almost missed seeing it! We visited the Vatican, but decided on a last minute whim to see this the morning before we left and so glad we did. It's very beautiful, and different from the other churches we have seen in Rome. It's also still an active parish, so there were quite a few people in prayer. A little nun asked me to help her take a picture on her iPhone, a neat memory for me. I wish I had the opportunity to go to mass there, but wrong day. Don't miss it, it's gorgeous and easy to find.

A must see on a pilgrimage. This is the biggest church dedicated to Mama Mary! For pilgrims, this is a must see! One of the 4 Major Basilicas in Rome, it was our last stop after St. Paul and St. John Lateran. We walked here from St. John Lateran. A relic from the manger is in the church right underneath the altar.

It's golden. Like literally there's gold everywhere. For a moment I started to snap some pics and then realized, there's no way my iPhone could capture the bedazzle of this basilica. So then I just walked around and stared, as I'm sure the people who built this incredible place intended.
well worth the walk to see it. again the magnitue of the paintings, stain glass, honors to religious l eaders etc of so long ago. is great to see.
Beautiful Basilica. Gorgeous church. I heard that it is the oldest in Rome. Somewhat distracted Mass because of tourists milling around.

Awesome. This place was such an experience to me. I'm not the most religious person, but it felt fantastic to light a candle for my late mother and godchild. The whole place truly felt as holy as it looks. The lack of respect the American tourists have for places like this are mind blowing. What do they have respect for then? Why visit a place like this if they can't show respect what other people hold dear?

Even more grand than I had thought. Spectacular Basilica with unreal art, history, and religious significance. We were surprised when we went through the structure at how large it was, and how beautifully decorated at every corner. There is a chance to pray at some of the wooden structure from the original "manger".
Beautiful..... Fantastic history and beautiful interior and exterior. a very simple church yet a lot of detail..fabulous decor.

Another magnificent Basilica in Rome!. My husband and I lost count of the number of churches we visited in Rome, but this was one of our favorites. Dating back to the 5th century, some of the original mosaics have managed to survive. Renovations were made over the centuries though, including updating the belfry in the 14th century to become Romanesque. The exterior took on a Baroque facade in the 18th century. One never ceases to appreciate the talent that put together all of the basilicas and churches in Rome and one does not tire of seeing the results.
An unexpected delight. We visited Santa Maria Maggiore and never expected it to be as good as it is.It is simply stunning.

wonderful church. Beautiful church , free entry, short queues due to security. Christopher Columbus gold ceilings, beautiful chapels, all welcome to Mass and the true Crib in the crypt. Memorable visit
One of the huge Roman churches. Well worth a visit and don't miss a much smaller and older church near bye with superb mosaics, Parrede.

The highest ranking Basilica devoted to the Virgin Mary is amazing.. Everything in the Church is so beautiful - the holy relics and Papal sculpture in the crypt; the side chapel showing the Madonna of the Snow story of the miaculous founding of this Church, its own Sistine Chapel, its Holy Sacrament Chapel; facade, Don't miss it!
Very Nice Church. It is a beautiful church, with nice paintings and statues. It is an active church you find masses most of the time. The atmosphere it is very spiritual. I loved it

Simply stunning . I wish I would have booked a tour for this church. The line is relatively small and moves very quickly. Once inside it simply takes your breath away. The high vaulted ceilings with their detail to the tile work on the floor. There is not one area found lacking. Don't forget to go downstairs. The Ascension chapel is impressive in its reverence and so peaceful. Absolutely a can't miss place in Rome.

Beautiful basilica. . Beautiful place and suprisingly quiet for such a big church, which seems a rarity nowadays. Tourists couldn't enter the church too far because a service was being held. Most people respected this, thankfully.

Beautiful major Basilica. This church (St Mary Major) is one of the 4 major basilicas in the Catholic Church. It is beautiful, and should be on anyone's list to see in Rome. We used a "one day Metro pass." That was we were able to attend all 4 major basilicas including this one, St Peter's, St John Lateran, and St Paul Outside the walls.

Beautiful Basilica. Go early to miss the crowds. Make sure you also go down into the crypt. A beautiful basilica in Rome. They do require a security check and shoulders and knees must be covered for both men and women.

Beautiful beautiful church. Found by hop on hop off bus. Spectacular church and well worth a visit. The side chapels are breathtaking needed to sit to take it all in.
In the city of churches this is a standout.

You must go. This was my second visit to Rome. On the first ocassion, I couln'dt visit, so this time it FIRST on my list. Loved all those chapels. The ambiance is a little spoiled with all the visitors, but it's worth visiting, regardless. After all, you're not the only one who NEEDS to go there.

Very Attractive Interior!. Visited at about 3:30 in the afternoon. Very small queue to get through security (about 5 mins). Inside was very impressive. There was a mass in German going on when we arrived and we couldn't access the Crypt of the Nativity under the high alter. However, once it had finished, the area opened up and we were able to go down the stairs and view what is apparently the remnants of Jesus' manger in beautiful surroundings. Gift shop and toilets available.
Another Must. Rome is full of places that must be seen and this is yet another one of them. Take the time to visit and you will be well rewarded.
Inspiring Mass. We attended the Sunday high mass on September 18, 2016. Mostly in latin with excellent choir and organ. A real spiritual treat.

One of the better. This basilica is magnificent and in some ways gives you a better feeling than the big one in the Vatican. Free entrance and photos allowed. I arrived early (09:30) and there was a short line of people at the entrance. 30 min later the church was packed with people and the line massive. Arriving early seems to be the right option. The place also have three other attractions, each of which have its own entrance fee. The museum is self guided but the papal rooms and the roman site under the church will be a guided tour. No signs about when the guided tour starts so you have to speak to the staff in the museum entrance to find out. Toilets (free but donation suggested) available at the church.
Spectacular. Another day and another Holy Door. Don't miss Santa Maria Maggiore, It is majestic and intimate at the same time and the Holy Door is open for a few more months.
Santa Maria Maggiore. Amazing artwork and history make this a must see if you are touring Christian Rome. Our daughter and her choir sang here once-amazing acoustics.

Santa Maria Maggiore, "The" Basilica with Caravaggio.... Roma is unique. Roma is the centre of the world. Roma is definitively the ONLY city in the world with 2 embassies per each Country (one to the Italian State and one to the Vatican State) - It is also the only place in the world encompassing 75% and more of World Archeological findings, Churches, Basilicas and Temples. A place to visit over and over. 3 days are not enough. And Santa Maria Maggiore one of the main 4 Basilicas is unique (and the only one with 2 main entrances on both sides) - Security during Giubileo and not only is guaranteed. Takes sometime to get into but security first! Services also in various languages and not only during the Giubileo year. Incredible works of art! Unique. Worth more than 2 hrs a visit.
Absolutely Stunning. Jaw Dropping.. We spent 5 days in Rome and this place was at the very top of our favorites. From floor to ceiling it is amazing and spiritual. Don't miss this jewel!

wonderful Roman basilica.. This is a beautiful church. You can walk right in (once you pass the security screening) and look around or attend mass. There are lots of services going on in the chapels. Don't forget to look up at the roof.

Stunningly beautiful! A must see!. This is one of the first places that we visited upon arrival to Rome. It is absolutely beautiful both inside and out. We went to Mass here on Sunday and it was awesome to see so many people in attendance from all cultures speaking different languages. One of the most interesting things to me was all of the confessionals. They're beautiful "boxes" the size of a wardrobe with the language spoken there listed on top. There is a red light above the window that lights up if there is a priest available for confession. The priest sits inside with the window partition open and those who wish to go to confession kneel on a kneeler just outside of the window. For some reason these were of great interest to me. LOL! There was a priest sitting in one near us and heard confession the entire time we were in Mass. In all seriousness, though, this church is a must-see. Unfortunately we missed one of the great relics here. Upon our return home my mother-in-law informed us that THE cradle of Jesus resides within the Basilica. I am so bummed that we missed that.

Basilica of Saint Mary Major. Beautiful visit. This is the second largest catholic church in Rome with stunning features, mosaics, and frescos. The line was not very long, but we visited early in the morning
Beuatiful Basilica!. We are so glad we came here. So much beauty. It was worth it to pay to see the beautiful mosaics on the second level. Our guide was very informative.

Absolutely beautiful. Visited few days ago. Not a well known tourist site but very close to our hotel. A must see basilica as very beautiful inside and huge. No queuing or masses of people so very enjoyable.

Magnificent Landmark. We walked for at least 30 minutes from where we were staying (near Trevi Fountain) but it was worth it. You are checked before your enter the church by security. The church is magnificent. A must see land mark.

Absolutely stunning. Fabulous church and well worth a visit, ;looking round the charge is free. Downside of our visit was the tour we paid for which was to see the treasures (which I have to say are great) the down side was our guide spoke to the Italians in Italian for a good while explaining what sounded like a lot of detail yet when it came to explaining in English we certainly didn't get the same detail as the Italians did so much we didn't join in for the last part of the tour - certainly felt like the poor relation on that tour. My advice is before you hand over any tour money check that the tour guide is fluent in English.

so much beautiful history. We really enjoyed the architecture.. This was a very beautiful historic place to visit. We really loved it.I could have done without it though and still been okay...but if you have the time, its pretty cool.

Beautifyl Basilica. This beautiful church has to be seen to believe. You really must visit here if you are in Rome for any reason. Was glad to see the security outside, but the line didn't take lomg to clear. Do visit!!

An overlooked Gem. In the Termini area I came across this Basilica which was absolutely beautiful inside. You are searched on the way in but it is done efficiently. Rather surprisingly there were no queues. It is much smaller than St Peters but very grand inside. Well worth a visit and the entrance is free just a request for a donation.

Beautiful basilica. Stunning beauty! This basilica is worth a stop. It has beautiful marble features, mosaics, and frescos. You have to go through a security check but it is quick and the lines never seem very long. The building is huge so it does not seem crowded.

Quietly beautiful. Having been to various other basilicas in Rome I have to say that this was my favourite by far. Beautiful and with a wonderful atmosphere. Plenty of places to sit and reflect. Be sure to visit the area beneath the altar...very unusual and beautiful. Well worth a visit.

One of the Great Pilgrimage Churches of Rome. This is one of the largest churches in Rome, with magnificent mosaics over the front triumphal arch and nave and the famous blessed Virgin Mary image which is the protectress of Roman people. These mosaics are truly amazing considering their age. Also, view the mosaics along the sides of the basilica recounting various old testament stories. This is an internationally famous church and a few of the chapels inside the church will regularly conduct masses for congregations of different nationalities. Also, make sure to look at the entrance door, fantastic designs on the floor and the resting place of Bernini. If you have time, try to visit the museum underneath the basilica - well worth a visit.
a MASSIVE and beautiful church. There are many beautiful churches in Rome, all of which are unique and worth the visit. This was definitely one of the most impressive by scale alone.

Lots to see inside. An unexpected visit turned out to be one of the highlights of our trip. Great artwork inside plus a museum in the basement. We also booked a tour of the archaeological site beneath the church. This is the remnants of a large house that the church is built on. The church was built in the fifth century, and the house pre-dates this. We also did a tour of the mosaics at the church, although both tours cost extra. Entrance to the church is free.

Off the beaten path but worth a visit. This is a magnificent basilica. If you are near the train station and have some time to kill, you might want to go here. It's a quiet respite from the busy via Cavour and the inside is stunning. There is a small museum which is somewhat interesting and there is a staircase by Bernini which we would have liked to see but it is only by guided tour and we didn't have time. Another trip.
Another beautiful building. First saw this beautiful building while on the open top bus your. Easy to find on foot. About 15 minutes walk from the colosseum. Small que to get in.

Beautiful. We visited here whilst in rome and is deffinately worth a look if you have time, its beautiful inside and is free entry. Dress code is fair, shoulders and knees should be covered. This was not strictly enforced however so I wpuld imagine it depends who you get.

Beautiful Basilica. This is a beautiful Basilica with a rich mixture of different architectural styles which is not surprising as the original Basilica dates from the 5th century and it was added to until late 15th century. So you have Romanesque bell towers, medieval rounders, Renaissance coffered ceilings and Baroque front and rear facades. Somehow it all seems to blend together seamlessly.Probably it most famous feature are its mosaics showing bible scenes and the Coronation of the Virgin by Jacopo Torriti in the apse.It is always busy but not crowded so you can enjoy the atmosphere regardless.

Architecture. We usually stay across the road from Santa Maria at the Domus Liberius. It provides beautiful views of the basilica's wonderful architecture. Visit the inside for a real treat. Simply fabulous.

Church born from the legend of the snow in the middle of summer. We arrived in Rome on August 5, when the St.Maria Maggiore Church was in celebration and it recalls (through a special religious procession) that snow which fell in the summer of the year 336 ( the legend marks the birth certificate of this impressive Cathedral). Beyond religious importance, this Papal church worth visiting for the tomb of one of the great architects and urbanists of Rome, Gian Lorenzo Bernini, and a staircase built by Bernini when he was teenager.
Amazing. Must do if your ever in Rome, this Basilica was a papal church so the inside is totally beautiful. One of the four major churches in Rome.
Lovely and Moving. Fabulous Basilica to see in person. The museum underneath was worth going into for a few extra Euro. There are amazing relics there. You can light candles in many of the chapels.
Outstanding!. Beautiful architecture, and artwork, it was so close to our hotel that we took a walk there every night after dinner. Really nice place to visit, pray, or simply admire...

Fabulous building. We were staying just next to this and it's exterior was only an introduction to a fabulous place. Beautiful architecture and worth doing the tour . a must is to see it in the evening .
Another beautiful one . Another great basilica, if you like them or not, don't miss on this one. Truely beautiful art, colors and colture.

A great basilica. We walked to the Basilica on our way to the Forum. This is an amazing church. There are papal remains, art, and more. There was a mass taking place, there were also priests available to hear your confession in just about any language. There are many churches to see while in Rome, I would put this one near the top of the list.

Magnificent Church.. One of the churches you must see when visiting Rome. Be prepared for a security check before gaining entry to the Basilica. If you approach from the rear of the building it may look closed but as we discovered it was open for visits.
Impressive. Really Impressive Basilica, really worth a visit, stunning architecture and history, highly recommend people to visit.

Truly Stunning. Honestly the single most beautiful building I have ever had the pleasure of seeing. We did the Vatican museums and chapel then my boyfriend went up to the Basilica while I waited in the courtyard bit. We then came out into the church and I was completely stunned! A must see when in Rome

Lovely place... Another beautiful basilica that you should not miss. Wonderful place and in my opinion, it comes very close to St Peter's Basilica in terms of beauty. Go take a look - you won't regret it.
must see basilica. breath-taking inside - such history in one place. Marvel at the many paintings on walls and ceiling. Such a big place too. You need to go though security to get in but its free.

Beautiful building. Well worth a visit if you are in this area. The hotel we were staying in was in the same piazza as this basilica so was just a short walk away but there is some amazing artwork inside and beautiful architecture.

Must visit. This is a super Basilica to visit very high security before entering
The music and singing was wonderful

Absolutely beautiful! . Can not put into words how beautiful this place is! The talent, craft and time put into creating this stunning building... just wow! I was left speechless. Pictures do not do it justice, it has to be seen to truly be in awe!

Wish we had caught it at a better time. This landmark was in the neighborhood of our hotel and when we woke up in the middle of the night due to jet lag we walked down to take a closer look about an hour before dawn. Even at that time we marveled at its stunning facade (sadly not open at that hour so we only got to see the outside). If we get to Rome again taking a look inside will be a high priority.

Pilgrimage. This is a major Papal Basilica in Rome. It is another overwhelmingly beautiful church. If you are visiting Italy especially if you are Catholic, this is a must see. Be sure to pass thru the Holy Door.
Just go inside and be amazed. We found this basilica by chance and what a surprise it was. The interior is stunning and the alter is amazing. This is a real jewel.

Favorite baptistry in the city! Amazing church. Whether you are a fan of art, a pilgrim seeking relics, an ancient history buff, or an architectural diehard - this basilica has it all. Must see the 'other' Sistine Chapel, Bernini's tomb, and the giant Pope Pius IX praying in front of the relic from Christ's manger. Wonderful art from several periods.

Very big spacious basilica. Wow! Big spacious basilica and on top of the wall there are all the Pope we have since Catholic begin. Wonderful, beautiful basilica. I am speechless. The artwork that I cannot comprehend, it is beautifully done and in details.

Piece of history. If you get the chance I would visit all of the Basilicas. Each one is unique in itself and full of history and beautiful art work, mosaics and statues. You can do this on your own or with a tour to get the full history of the Basilica.

Church Mass. This was a special
Mass service. The church is breathtaking and a must do in Rome. The art collection here alone would be worth the visit.
Have communion here if you are Catholic is one of the best.

One step away from heaven. This is the most wonderful place to visit. If you enter the Basilica with a troubled heart I think you will find utter peace and tranquility here. I found it very emotional.
Entered threw the Holy Door and attended Mass. Beautiful church, our guide, through Cosmos was wonderful describing the mosaics, and frescoes, the mass was authentic Italian.

Another wonderful church. There are so many wonderful churches in Rome which are, at least in part, more than a millennium old. This basilica is one such church, with 5th century columns and mosaics, as well as apse mosaics from the 12th century, not to mention the spectacular ceiling from the early 16th century and the exquisite baroque side chapels. Well worth a look in if you have the time.
Beautiful. Don't miss this beautiful church. Stunning inside! Free to visit. Also has a museum that costs 5 euro but I wasn't able to see that.

Beautiful and historical. As other reviewers have said, this basilica is often overlooked in city tours, which is unfortunate. I found out about it because I stayed in a hotel nearby. The basilica is very close to Termini station, the queue is not long (I went on September), and the building is gorgeous, you won't miss it.There is no entrance fee (which was a nice surprise for me). Like in any other churches/basilicas, you have to dress up properly to go in. If you want to explore more about the basilica's history, there's an interactive machine that will give you info for €2. The church is connected to a museum (entrance fee €3) and archaelogical site (I didn't visit, but entrance fee is €5).The interior is beautiful. There are rooms inside the basilica which function as chapels. My favorite is the Borghese chapel. You can spend hours visiting this less crowded basilica and admiring its decorations.

Basilica Di Santa Maria Maggiore. An amazing place to visit and take in your beautiful surroundings. You must also take in the history of the Basilica and spend some "me" time understanding the religious importance of the Basilica not just the building and decorations.
Honeymoon. A beautiful church dedicated to The Virgin Mary The Mother of Jesus! Absolutely beautiful and is a must see on your trip.
Magnificent. Absolutely fantastic& incredible architecture, certainly have to visit during your trip to Rome& Italy

Beautiful!. One of our must-visit Churches while in Rome. This is very beautiful, and there was some sort of celebration going on while we were there because it was almost Mama Mary's birthday.
They are pretty strict with the dress code so make sure to cover up your shoulders and knees.
Wow!. There is a lot of interesting basilica in Rome, this is one of my favorite. Very close to Rome Termini so it is easy to get there.
sightseeing. beautiful place to visit. take your time to appreciate all of its beauty. quite busy place but worth the visit.

Impressive. Visited Santa Maria Maggiore late in the afternoon. I had been there before, but hadn't visited the excavations beneath the Basilica, which was well worth the extra time and money. The Basilica was built on top of a home, and that is the subject of the excavation. Some of the frescoes and floor mosaics are intact. It gives a nice insight into Roman life, probably among the upper class.
Awesome. Fantastic art. Light a candle for a loved one. Holy lace to be in. We were privileged to hear a group of nuns sing in there and it was angelic.
Ms. Lucy. It is beautiful basalica. It was great to see it. But be aware of strict control before you enter. And you should have appropriate clothes.

Holiday in Rome. I was leaving at 2 pm for the airport and decided to take a morning walk around the hotel. Surprised to see this Basilica, it is beautiful and large. I spent more than an hour in the Basilica, somehow no tour guides ever mentioned this Basilica to me when I was in Rome. Don't miss it when in Rome.

A must see. This place stole my heart from the minute I seen it. A basilica built in honour of Mary. Legend has it that the Virgin Mary appeared to Pope Liberius and the patrician Giovanni Patrizio on the night of August 4, 352 telling him to build a church on the Esquiline Hill and that he would be shown where. That night it snowed and he marked the spot where the basilica now stands. And so every year on August 5, white rose petals are dropped into the sanctuary from an opening in the ceiling of Saint Mary Major to commemorate its legend. Under the high altar of the basilica is the Crypt of the Nativity with a crystal reliquary said to contain food from the Holy Crib of the nativity of Jesus Christ.Bernini is buried here under a simple marking place that so many people miss it. It simply says Bernini, he decorated the city.It is truly a spectacular basilica and one i founf myself drawn to daily. Confessions in all languages are available daily and the mass, in latin, makes you feel like you are truly blessed. If you have time i suggest you take the short tour for 5 euros, it will take you upstairs to the balcony where you can see the frescos and arches depicting the history of the church and also some ancient papal relics.
OMG-you have to see this. There is an actual relic here containing 4 pieces of wood from the Holy Cradle from the birth of Jesus. We had no idea this even existed, this was amazing to see

Unbelievable Beauty. Sunday Morning Mass. When in Rome, instead of visiting this church as a tourist, we visited to attend mass and experience worship in another culture and in another language. Beautiful church, second only to St. Peter's. We visited this church as part of Roman Christian tour. Many beautiful statues, paintings, and burial site of Bernini. Would go again as much to see.

Wonderful church. Don't be fooled by 17th and 18th Century updates, this church is nearly 1,200 years old. Some of its columns pre-date the church which represents the dying Rome's transition from its old gods to the Christian one. It is very beautiful and should be on every visitor's MUST SEE list.

Truly majestic and impressive.

Awe Inspiring. Will take ur breath away! A must see. Be sure to turn around at the front of the church to view the entrance .

Did You Know There Are Two Sistine Chapels?. The Sistine chapels were built under the direction of Pope Sixtus the Fifth. One chapel ls adjacent to the Vatican museum. A place for quiet reflection. This basilica is across the street from the Mecenate Palace Hotel and we viewed it out our window. The interior is nothing short of absolute beauty and so quiet; and, it's not crowded with people. Being one of Rome's oldest churches this site has a lot of history.

Just Awesome!. This well known basilica is one of the most beautiful places and churches that I have seen in Italy. Neither words nor photos can describe the beauty of this basilica. Not to be missed when you are in Rome!

City break. Quite stunning from inside. There is also a Museum inside for which there is a charge. It is a shame that you have to go through security to enter a church but I guess this is now the world we live in.

Built by a 'miracolo'!. The third largest church in Rome - full of magnificent mosaics and rich sculptures. Visiting on a sunny day is best - otherwise bring euros to pop into the 'light machines'. Oh yes, don't miss the very modest little marker on the side steps to the altar - it marks the resting place of Gian Carlo Bernini, the man who designed the baldachino in St. Peter's, the grand piazza of that church, and created the Fountain of the Four Rivers in the Piazza Navona.

STUNNINGLY SACRED. We visited the Basilica after having been to St Peter's in the morning. After the wonder of St Peter's I was skeptical about my ability to be wowed by any other church. An impressive basilica.. Italy being the country of the most beautiful churches, this basilica had breathtaking paintings and sculptures.

To Be seen!. Rome is a beautiful city.. Every where you look in Rome it is like being in an amazing art gallery/ museum. The Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore in no exception gorgeous and peaceful. I was there in 2004 and 2008. I choose the furthest date that the drop down would allow.
Stunning. Italy has so many churches but once you are inside you can see why they are so famous. The craftsmanship and the artwork are all amazing.

Great . It was so so beautiful
Rome over all is a beautiful place to visit. People are so friendly and the panorama view is important to see.
This church is so beautiful and it is a must be seen

Last Visit of the Holidayy. worth visiting. Very interesting baroque church with fantastic mosaicks on the walls and behind the main altar, also there are quite a few first-class sculptures of Bernini there. Worth visiting

Dropped In. We passed this on the way to Colesseum and decided to visit on way backIf visiting you must cover shoulders and knees and this strictly adhered to although they give up temporary shawls at entranceEntrance is free however we paid the additional 5 euro each to do the tour of the upper level and view the Bertoni mosaic The church itself is stunning but the additional tour lasting approx 30 mins is not to be missed

Afternoon part of a combined Vatican, Sistine Chapel (AM) and three other Papal Basillica's (PM). Both parts of this tour were excellent and very good value for money. Jumping the queue was an added extra but the knowledge of the guides was extremely high. We visited the Vatican last year and upon our return this year we were equally amazed. Disappointed that our visit last year did not incorporate the Sistine Chapel, we were thrilled that we got to see it this year. Truly breath taking and worth a visit to Rome just to see this. The afternoon visit to the three other Papal churches was a new trip for us and I wasn't sure what to expect but WOW, we loved it. The tour guide Georgia (Geodar81674) was the best guide we have ever had on any tour. Her enthusiasm and knowledge was top class and we were sad when the trip had finished. This is a must do tour when visiting Rome and if you think that St Peter's Basilica is the best Rome has to offer you will rethink your opinion after seeing the other three Papal churches. I cannot recommend this enough. A real must see, especially if you are lucky enough to have Geodar81674.
Stunning. Breathtaking and very emotional. The history and artwork make a visit essential. Remember to be respectful and cover your shoulders!!

Nice church worth a look. This was close to our hotel and we were able to squeeze in an hour and a half before we left for the airport. Well worth the effort it was beautiful and the mosaics were lovely. There's a tour up to the balcony where you get a closer look at them but otherwise you are on your own. Plan to see it as soon as possible. It is an outstanding collection of architecture, paintings, history and statues. Just to remind you, ladies you need to cover your shoulders and knees . A must see!. Would highly recommend visiting the peoples Basilica, absolutely stunning. Take you time to sit in the peaceful surroundings!

Columbus brought gold from the new world that was used in this church. I stayed in a hotel across the way from this beautiful cathedral and had a lovely view from our hotel room window. It is well worth the visit, both inside and out. (The hop on hop off has a stop in the circle on the south side of the church.) It is one of several Vatican churches located outside of Vatican City. Lovely. Another lovely basilica in Rome--just like the others. Not too busy and looks a lot nicer inside than on the outside. Seriously--not fair how many beautiful sights are packed into this one city.

wishing you visit extend for long time. This is the second visit in 4 years ..while you entered you will get a feel of great spirituality . the paints .the church columns and the smell and everything made you wish your visit extend for a long time

Must see. Visited on first day, close to our hotel.
Recommend you visit, also saw a concert outside on the Friday evening.

A beautiful place to visit.. I first visited this church the day after I arrived in Rome. It was beautiful and not too crowded. We could see it from our hotel and hear the bells ringing out. It was comforting knowing it was close by. The frescoes and sculptures were beautiful. There was an air of calmness and just sitting there looking at the ceiling was wonderful. I know the two places are totally different and of course the experiences are different but after the crowds and the size of the Vatican and it's environs it was a great relief to come back and sit in the beautiful quiet space of Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore. Beautiful . One of the most beautiful Basilicas, don't forget to get a short tour to the balcony to admire the ancient mosaic. The stuff was well informed and really nice. No waiting, except a simply security check. They also give a kind of "scarf" for free if you are not dressed appropriately.
Popular. This is a lovely and well situated church that makes for a popular tourist site. However, in my opinion, there are many and varied other churches in Rime more an this one.

Always a favorite - simply breathtakingly beautiful!. This is a stunning church, both inside and out. There is no admission price. Magnificent Marian Basilica in the Heart of Rome!. This 5th century Major Basilica, Saint Mary Major, is a definite must see for the amazing art and history that it holds. The gilded ceiling is out of this world!

Beautiful church . We visited this basilica after a visit to the nearby piazza. It is a very beautiful church and is a must see when visiting Rome. If you are visiting, please ensure you are covered up otherwise you will need to loan a shawl for €1. No photos can be taken either.

Beautiful Experience. The church was two min walking distance from our hotel so we kept it for last thinking to do it when we do not have any plans . We almost not ended up not going there - and what a loss it would have been. The 5th century church is beautifully renovated and has amazing interiors. The gold gild and the objects are remarkeable.....

Great church try to catch Sunday Latin mass for a special treat . Don't miss this church it is worth visiting! Catching Latin mass especially on Sunday is a real special experience. Great music at this mass.
Mother Mary's Basilica. This is the largest Basilica in honor of Mother Mary, mother of Christ. This is a must see as well while in Rome. The exterior and as well as interior is a wonder to see.

Golden ceiling. A fantastic Basilica. The 'piece of wood from the crib of Jesus' was a bit hard to swallow but the silver container built to hold it was eye wateringly ornate. The first gold sent back from the New Wold was used to gild the ceiling (a gift to the Pope from the Spanish King and Queen). Amazing mosaics and one of the Jubilee churches to visit if doing the pilgrimage.

A Majestic Basilica. In my opinion, this large basilica is the most attractive from the outside of the several in Rome. There's a very graceful stepped bell tower set off to one side of the roof; a beautiful 18th-century entryway with large, airy openings on two levels; and, at the back of the building, a broad flight of steps leading down the slope of a hill the church is on. (Santa Maria Maggiore is situated in one of the highest districts of Rome.) An odd thing about the major facade of the church is that there are two palaces flanking it, and built right into the church's body. At first I thought they were apartment buildings!The major attractions inside are the 5th-century basilica floor plan, and the richly gilded ceiling with recessed square panels, going the length of the interior. Also important are the 5th-century mosaics just below the windows, but to see them properly you need a pair of binoculars.There's also a canopy (called a tabernacle) over the main altar. It's like a smaller version of the one in St Peter's. I especially like the gold vines wrapping themselves around each column and spiralling upward. The columns down the length of the church are in straight rows and are very pure and simple. They were originally part of an ancient Roman building. In the right aisle, down near the altar, is a simple marble tomb marking where Bernini was buried. It's easy to miss; I had to ask someone.With such a lovely interior, I don't know why they filled it with ugly red 1970s-looking plastic chairs that clash with the rest of the interior! They cheapen the interior, and aren't even comfortable to sit on! I noticed that security at the entrance was very thorough. I liked that. The church also has an excellent, easy to easy-to-navigate, website.

Well Worth A Visit . This church was within walking distance of our hotel. It's a UNESCO site & the largest church in Rome that's dedicated to the Virgin Mary. Although the original building dates back to the 5th century, it has been extensively renovated over the years. The interior is beautifully decorated with paintings & mosaics...just beautiful!
Wonderful place to have Mass. One of my favorite Basilica in Europe. It is a lovely place to have mass without too much crowd or tourist.

Worth a visit. This was worth a visit with beautiful marble and decorative frescos and mosaics but obviously not in the same scale as St Peter's. Set in a nice piazza with fountain. Plenty of cafes surrounding area to spend some time.

One of the Great Basilica to Visit While in Rome. Many of the basilicas are dark and not very uplifting. This one isn't that way. It is beautiful, very ornate, well tended and a popular tourist attraction. As others will tell you it is quite beautiful, what I found so engaging was the lightness of the building,the detail within the individual sculptures, the light and beauty of it all. Allow yourself some time to sit quietly and just contemplate the beauty of it all. You will come away a better and happier person.
Beautiful. It is as beautiful on the outside as it is inside. Not far from the Coloseum, it is worth spending some time inside.
Wonderful!!!. This is a beautiful place. You must tour this Basilica. The massive sculptures and paintings are beautiful. The tombs here are interesting...

Beautiful. Right beside our hotel, this was the first place we visited when we arrived in rome, I wasn't dissapointed. Words cant explain the beauty of this place, went to confession here and also sunday mass, was once in a lifetime thing and brought home holy water from the fountains.

Peaceful and beautiful. True it is the most beautiful church after the Vatican. Once you enter you will feel the peace and serenity of the place. Beautiful ceiling that you will simply admire. Paintings, sculptures and floor are all perfectly maintained. Also a visit to the musuem is a must.
no lines and free. Unlike the Basilica di San Pietro and San Paolo, this place did not have a line! I wasn't expecting much but OMG what beauty and craftsmanship.

Superb. Nothing that I will say will get even close to describing its beauty. If you are religious or if you just like church inner architecture then this is a place that you really have to see. It's size is impressive and coupled together with its beauty makes it a "MUST SEE". There is a possibility to visit the museum, which is a small museum under the church itself. You can get the tickets at the entrance into the church.The entrance into the church is of course free

One of the four Basillica's of Rome.. I had the honor of joining our daughter in this magnificent Basilica for a concert by the Italian Symphony. This is one of the four major Basilica's in Rome and is a must see.
A must in Roma.. It s a real gifted holly place, It was a great service there, The church is very beautiful and close from Sa Pietro in Vincoli.
Don't miss this church. Beautiful church ,you must see .Their is a pice wood from the bed of Jesus .Also beautiful paintings and wonderful altar
Another great Church of Rome!. This is a wonderful Basilica to visit! Take the time to learn about everything that is in this Church. It is fascinating!

Amazing gem on a morning walk. Some of the most incredible mosaic works in rome, and, I could experience them up close. A quiet place, people were of the church atmosphere. A must see for those who shy away from big scenes...it really takes you can in time to the eras of the chirch in rome. Beautiful.

Beautiful basilica. One of the four major papal basilicas, this is a beautiful church both inside and out. This was actually the first church we visted in Rome on our way from our hotel at Termini to visit the colosseum. Definitely worth visiting.

The most stunning church in Rome, next to the Vatican. We went in here because it was close to where we were staying, not because we'd heard so much about it. So glad we did though, because it was stunning! Truly the best church we saw on our whole trip through Italy. And it's free (or donation)! Even our young daughter was quite enamored by it. Highly recommended.

Yet another wonder of Ancient Rome . Completely wonderful amazing old building and great to take in as you walk from Coliseum to Trevi.
Only problem is that all the ancient stiff blurs into one if you visit all of these attractions.

Great place for Pentecost Mass. Good to be staying within 3 minutes walk and so to get easily to Pentecost Mass with both the current and previous Cardinal Archpriest of the Basilica; wonderful liturgy; choir in best Italian form with brass quintet.

It is just a 5-minute walk to the Basilica from Termini and it is really worth the visit. The entrance is free but they have a museum nearby which charges 3 euros. Beautiful Building… free!. This Church was just a short walk from the last hotel we stayed at in Rome, near the Train Station. The line to get in was short, even though Rome was crowded that day, and its free to get in. There's a lot of people inside, but not where you can't get some good photos. Really an amazing site, as there is a lot of gold leaf used in this building & the light reflects, especially in the domes (there are 2)!

Worth a visit. In a country with exceptional churches, this papal basilica is still quite exceptional and given it is fairly close to the city center (unlike San Giovanni), it is worth the hike, if only to see its ornate ceiling and great frescoes.
Beautiful. This is a beautiful basilica. We attended Mass and also toured the Church another day. The lines are not as long as St. Peter's and it is worth taking a tour.

Beautiful and moving. Not as well known as the other major basilicas in Rome, but equally beautiful. Worth putting a couple of Euros into the talky machine. Just amazing frescos. And of course, the crypt..........there's a special treat in there for you, especially if you are of Christian persuasion or interested in religious history.

Not on the tourist map but...... .....worth a visit if you are in the area. One of four 'papal basilicas': visited by the Pope before and after international trips. It contains another Sistine Chapel dedicated to Sixtus V: beautifully light.

Large basilica. One of the largest Papal basilicas but possibly not the most impressive church in Rome.
Free to enter (although you must have any bags X-rayed similar to airports before entry). One to keep in mind if its wet and there are other sites around the Repubblica that are worth visiting.

A favorite of Rome's grand cathedrals. This cathedral is not as imposing as St Peter, which is a nice respite from the drama of the Vatican. It feels more "neighborhood-y" and accessible as well but with exquisitely beautiful gold and mural interior.
Beautiful Basilica. Close to the Termini station. We visited while doing a 4 major basilica tour with City of Wonder/Discovery tours. Definitely worth the visit. Also has a holy door.

Nots that shoulders and knees have to be covered out of respect or you will be refused entry. Tours and museum I think can be bought fir extra Eurostar but we didn't bother and found it interesting.
Holy door pilgrimage. Absolutely beautiful. The Basilica offers confessions in many languages. Bernini is buried in the church. Very heartwarming experience.
great mosaics. This church has some of the nost beautifulnosaics in Rome.Do not miss Bernini tomb difficult to find to the left from main altar

Don't miss this. Go early and the lines will be less daunting. We didn't take a tour and found just strolling around was amazing. You can take pictures inside and enjoy at your own pace. No fee to tour the Basillica and the piazza in front.
Great place . Love love the place and the security there seems to really be on alert and it's so peaceful walking through and lightning the candles.

Stunningly beautiful!. We went here for Sunday mass. It was in Italian but being Catholic all my life, I knew what was going on. I like to go to a Catholic mass in the language of the country that I am visiting. It is more authentic that way. After mass, we walked around the church. We spent hours, and wanted to spend more time but we had a tour scheduled. It was gorgeous! I can't describe how beautiful, grand, holy it was. It was nice to look around and sit and say a prayer. It was located near our hotel so we walked past if often. I have a beautiful picture of it at night with a full moon. That evening, our group just stopped and stared. It also has a cute, small gift shop attached.
Beautiful . Beautiful church with an amazing ceiling. Not much information given about it's history, but worth a stop, it's free after all

Shoulders and knees covered . Make sure to cover your shoulders and knees, otherwise they will provide you with a piece of cloth, kind of. They reuse the same one over and over without washing them! When it is like today, 38 Celsius, we are all hot and sticky! Not sure I want to be putting this on my shoulders!There is no cost to enter this Basilica but must go through security and it is beautiful. Worth it!
Great place to visit. A great place to visit and fairly central. Very beautiful and great to visit whether for a few minutes or longer, it is quite large. Some security but worth it

Sunday Latin mass. We attended Sunday mass here in July. The basilica is welcoming despite the fact that we did have to enter through a metal detector and have our bags scanned. We don't speak Italian but as practicing Catholics we enjoy the ritual of the mass and felt honored to be able to celebrate the mass in such a beautiful basilica. Beautiful!!. Gorgeous basilica with gold ceilings and beautiful paintings. You had to go through security to get in, but it was so worth it! I know there are many lovely churches in Rome, but this one was really special.
Lovely church to visit.. Don't be put off by the airport style security before you enter as the inside is worth the visit with classic paintings and a beautiful alter.
Nice basilica. This was close to our hotel so decided to visit. It is a nice and quiet basilica with lots of history. There was some security to go through, but well worth it.
A must stop in Rome. A wonderful place not far from main train station. Overwhelmingly beautiful and great to visit whether for a few minutes or longer, it is quite large.
wow. aside from vatican, this is probably the most beautiful church in rome for me. the architecture is surreal and you'll definitely be in awe once you get inside.

The most beaaaaautiful!!. It's incredible how you can't stay with your eyes really opened to see all that this Basilica has inside!
One of my biggest favorits!
Loved all of it.

Breathtaking & Beautiful. As you approach the church the size is impressive but as I walked in I just stood in silence at the beauty within. There is an attendant on the door as you enter to let you borrow a cloth cover up as shoulders and above knees should not be exposed inside the church. The intricate detail inside is from floor to ceiling. As you walk round, with everyone having a respectful silence, there are individual praying areas and altars. At the back of the church stands a magnificent throne chair and marble stairs down to a big marble statue and a place to kneel and pray or sit quietly with your thoughts surrounded by marble and delicate decor. Absorbing the beauty and history of this church will be one of my cherished memories of my visit to Rome.
Beautiful Church . This is a huge basilica, one of the key 4 of Rome and a very beautiful place, full of art and full of gold everywhere...very impactful.
Nice church wirh famous background. This church is not far from Termini bustation. We went on a sunday just before a service started. Nice artwork and good atmosphere

One of the four Cathedrals of Rome. The name of the church ("major") indicates that is indeed an important place of worship within the Roman Catholic Church. It is one of the impressive church building to visit in Rome.One of the many highlights in the basilica is the beautiful coffered ceiling designed by Giuliano da Sangallo and placed there in the 16th century. The Santa Maria Maggiore also contains some interesting tombs such as those of pope Sixtus and renowned sculptor Gian Lorenzo Bernini.The column with a bronze statue of Maria and child in front of the church was erected in 1615 in thanksgiving for the remission of the plague during the Baroque period.
Another beautiful church. Thjjs one is one of the most beautiful churches in Rome. There are lots of break off areas each as iridible as the main area. Well worth a visit.

Archaeological site! . This is a beautiful church, there is a hidden wonder underneath that I cried at visiting as well as at the Church. Friends had asked me to light a candle they're not tea lights but when you add an offering 'auto candles'
Loverly interior church.. Large church with some interesting architecture outside and inside.Not a main busy Torisem site but worth a visit after.
Beautiful. We visited this Church when we were in Rome this summer. It is truly beautiful...if you have the chance take the time and visit it.
A must see!. Amazing Papal Basilica, one of four, that is a must see! The building is a gem with beautiful art work throughout.
Great Architecture!. Churches are quiet similar in views but this one is really astonishing. Walking distance from termini.
Breathtaking. Could have stayed for hours as there is so much to take in. You must remember to dress appropriately as a lot of people were turned away

Worth the Visit. The location is very easy to reach from Termini station, like 10 min walk. This Church is fantastic and worth the visit. Outstanding detailed Art which takes us back to old times efforts, Art, culture and Hard work !!! Lovely not to miss..

Fantastic decoration. Another must visit even if you are not religious. The Basillica is huge with numerous chapels along the outer internal walls. The decoration is breath takingly beautiful. Take a moment to reflect whilst resting in the pews.
