Beautifullllllllll. Amazing Basilica,beautiful ceiling, wall and ceiling painitngs, beautiful marble work from floor to ceiling it is so rich that you dont know where to look .another beautiful romaine basilica , breath taking , well maintained .

Georgious Basilica. This basilica was built due to the request of our Lady and as a sign, St. Mary asked God to do a miracle. Then on that summer time God sent snow just on the spot where He wanted the Basilica to be built. Amazing church!

Beautiful inside & out!. We went here as a part of our pilgrimage in February 2016. We actually went multiple times because it was walking distance from our hotel. Our 1st night, we went only to see the exterior and to visit the gift shop in the church. Then, we went on a full guided tour another day. Lastly, we had mass there another day. It is gorgeous.
Truly beautiful church. One of four papal basilicas in Rome. Said to have been built at the site of a snowfall that occurred on August 5, 358.

Amazing. This beautiful church is well worth a visit. They have security and you must cover yourself. They provide wraps if your shoulders and legs are bare. The ceilings floors and walls are incredible. An alter everywhere you look with elaborate carvings and paintings. It is a working church with confessionals that cater to many languages along the length of the church. There is a recorded history available if you put money in a slot near the entrance which tells you more of the history of this church which belongs to the Vatican but it is outside the holy state and on Italian soil.

As the Pope does, so must we DO !!!. It has been a tradition of Pope Francis to visit this church before and after his international visits. Revered to be the Mother church home of our Salus polus - Mother protector of Rome - who once saved the entire city from a plague. Ornately designed and love attending holy mass at their chapel.

Go on the archaeological tour!. The church is amazing and well worth the visit, but the archaeological tour made our day. Go to the museum and see that too, but for €5 each (2people) a personal tour of the otherwise locked underground area was mind boggling; foundations and parts of previous buildings. Our English speaking guide was knowledgeable but a bit hard to understand, the guy at the desk had no English, and we had no Italian but we worked it out anyway.

Business or Religion. Tried to confess to a Priest after 30 years. Response was...sorry we closing...come back tomorrow. Was meant as a pilgrimage to my wife and I. Was there as the Pope started a movement for tolerance. How disappointed can anyone be? I could continue venting for an hour but readers can make their have opinions.
un - expected. this was a suprise when you went in, well worth a visit. straight in and wasn't crowded. beautiful church

Quite amazing, with caveats. Quite a great church really. Long hallway with amazing details all over. Visit this basilica first, then the other famous one! Otherwise your expectation will be betrayed. There's a gated area on the left and right, that's opened to public sometime. This church is dedicated for Santa Maria as the name suggest.
Sublime. Once you're in, you feel the great peace of the sound isolation from outside. Take a look at the murals and glass mosaics, definitely worth the visit.

Honourable. We went inside but the guards didn't let us enter in shorts and tops. They gave us clothes to cover our shoulders and legs. But it absolutely worth it because the inside of this basilica is quite beautiful.

Stumbled upon this gen. We were walking around the city on a self guided random tour during a free day and walked up the gigantic steps near the Basilica and decided to check it out. A wedding was about to start but security let us in the back for a quick stop to see the amazing architecture and artistry of this place. Free.

Once in a lifetime. We went to the Basilica to go through the Sacred Door during the Jubilee Year of Mercy and we happened to attend a Mass on June 26, 2016 for "Our Lady of Perpetual Health", held only once every 150 years. A Magical Experience
Gorgeous Basilica. Along with the Archbasilica of Saint John Lateran, this church should not be missed when sightseeing Christian Rome.

A piece of history . Visited one morning and what's a wonderful site, the detailing of the monuments and wall inside is something truly amazing. Please don't be put off by the security this place is a national treasure and staff are friendly. You don't need to visit for long just make sure you do.

Breathtaking . A phenomenal church. We actually went on a Sunday during the mass service. It was somewhat busy with tourists but also was filled with people in worship of their God. It is truly a masterpiece! There are no benches, they put out chairs for services, because the floors are mosaics which are truly works of art. There are statues and paintings galore with a stunning area at the head of the central nave. This should be a must on everyone's list.

Bernini is Buried Here!. Significant Church. Holds the "wood" relic from Christ's manger. Bernini is buried here. Surprisingly, his burial place is marked only by a simple gravestone marker. Perhaps, Bernini should have made his own marker prior to his death!
Beautiful . We stayed at a hotel opposite the Basilica and popped over in the rain to have a quick look. Over an hour passed before we were finished, it's a beautiful place even for the non-religious
Beautiful!. Just when you think you've seen enough Churches in Rome...you walk into another beauty. Santa Maria Maggiore is no exception!
Do not miss this Basilica. One of the oldest Basilicas in Rome and well worth a visit. Inside it is calm, cold and beautiful. If you are close by do not miss it!
Beautiful . We stayed near this basilica but went there on the last day, I'm glad I did as I enjoyed it more than St. Peter's, it was beautiful and less crowded.
Basilica visits. Rome isn't just for the Vatican. There is amazing basilica across the city, much more personal and just as ornate as St Peters. Such an amazing city. Ti amo Roma!
Fantastic church. Not one of the main tourist places which is good as it is fairly quiet. Stunning inside. Well worth a visit.
Beautiful Church. In a city full of beautiful churches, this is one of the best. with fantastically ornate columns, ceilings ,dome and artwork. A really impressive sight to visit !

Inspiring. This is a huge Basilica. So much to see. Give yourself time to look around and reflect. If Mass is in session, you can't see much, but it's a great place to sit and rest or take part in the service.
Wonderfull Church. Beatifull ancient mosaics. One of the four great basilicas in Rome. Also look nearby for Santa Parsed.
Beautiful. Very beautiful church, we did a tour, very interesting - precious mosaics and nice stories during the tour

Go in, despite the Security screening. In an epitaph to our troubled times, the security to get in is like an airport. ladies also cover you shoulders and knees or a shroud will be provided. Stunning interiors and side chapels; look up at the roof also. Go down into the crypt to the kneeling marble lifesize pope and reliquary. It is just 3m from main railway station so can be a last stop off before back to airport. In this part of Rome, not to be missed
Wedding of a lifetime. We had the hot of attending the most beautiful wedding here. The church is beyond beautiful. Everything in this area of Rome is breathtaking.
Stunning . Beautiful, classy add elegant chapel which is awe inspiring with its decadence and grandeur. One of the most stunning churches in Rome which is high praise indeed.Go and see when in Rome
Beautiful reluc. Stopped by to admire the detail of this lovely building as we walked to Termini. We didn't pop inside however. Another special character that is part of the uniqueness of Rome.

A beautiful place that changes through the day!. A beautiful place of worship. If you visit at the beginning of the day (7am-ish) you wouldn't believe it to be a tourist site. You hear the early morning services, and you feel you are intruding, so you tiptoe around, feeling truly blessed to be allowed in this place. Come back around 4 hours later and the place has transformed into a tourist attraction, with people everywhere disobeying the dress code and talking loudly. And a gift shop appears from nowhere! Only about a 5min walk from Termini so if you have half-hour to spare before a train, it's well worth a pop-in!
Stunning. Absolutely did not expect anying so beautiful as we walked in. Well worth looking at om the way to see the Trevi Fountain
Beautiful church. Be prepared for security control, otherwise you don´t get in. A beautiful church as most of churches in Rome.

Stunning - but leave time for security checks!. This landmark building is well worth a visit, and it is well worth queuing to go through quite thorough security to enter. As in most Roman churches, look up and marvel. Sumptuous art work surrounds you. You need plenty of time to wander round this huge edifice, not forgetting to turn in every direction in case you miss something. The roof is simply stunning and the dark altar is reminiscent of other Vatican 'copies' with a huge canopy and columns wound with gold. I recommend you find time to sit down at various points in order to gaze at the ceiling without getting dizzy. One of the most beautiful churches I've ever seen.

Beautiful basilica without crowds. Located on Esquiline HIll in the Monti neighborhood and one of the four papal basilicas in Rome, Basilica Santa Maria Maggiore is a most beautiful basilica. As many other posts mention, prior reading about this basilica can enhance the visit. A visit is worthwhile for many reasons. The artwork is beautiful: there are mosaics and frescoes throughout the basilica. The gilded ceiling--said to be gilded with gold from Columbus' travel to America--is spectacular. There are no crowds or lines so if your time is limited in Rome, you can leisurely appreciate the artwork. Tickets are not required and there is no entrance fee. The neighborhood is busy and there are many restaurants within a few blocks.Reading about this basilica beforehand or having a knowledgeable guide will help to fully appreciate your visit. If there were not so many other prominent destinations in Rome, this magnificent basilica might be a focus of your visit.

Sombre, but amazing. Of the many churches in Rome, we were strongly advised to visit the Basilica and were very glad that we did - twice! Unlike the Vatican it wasn't crowded or noisy and the visitors were respectful providing plenty of time and space for reflection on the building itself, its magnificent dark and sombre interior, and its wonderful art work.

Nice to see. On the way from Termini to the Colosseum on the Cavour street you will see on your left hand this big church. Even you don't have enough time to enter you can just split some time to take some pictures from outside. On the front there is the piazza of S.Maria Maggiore with a small fountain.

Beautiful Basilica. A Beautiful Basilica in Rome second to St Peter's in my opinion. Beautifully decorated inside with lots of interesting mosaics. Bernini is buried within the church definelty worth a visit.

Blown away!. We did not plan to go here but stopped in after visiting San Pietro in Vincoli. IMHO it is more ornate than St Peter's with great architecture. Every inch of the walls and ceiling are covered in some artwork, mosaic, or statue. There are 2 side chapels that were both breathtaking. We were lucky enough to hear a female choir singing for a service while we were there which added to the beauty of the church. It may not have any of the most famous artworks (the baldacchino by Fuga competes with Bernini's) but the overall views in this basilica are second to none.
Very nice cathedral. This cathedral has beautiful leaded glass and murals. In addition to the main chapel there are four other side chapels that are also quite beautiful.
Magnificient!. The cool and majestic basilika is a great landmark, but also offers a peaceful place right on the way to the busy station-area.

Beautiful artwork. This was the first church building I had seen in Rome. I was amazed by the architecture and the artwork. It made me wonder how long and how many people it took to complete the project. It's free to go in. Women need to cover the shoulder and legs. They provide a veil to cover the legs.

Surprised by its Grandeur. We weren't intending to visit this Basilica but were very pleased we did. The outside of the structure hides a magnificent internal treasure trove of artwork and sculpture. Definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful Church. This really is a must see when in Roma. Just beautiful inside. Excellent historic site close to other locations.

Our Lady of the Snow. This is a magnificent basilica with an amazing history - built on the place where our lady had snow fall. BUT IT DOES NOT CLOSE AT 7 - it closes at 6:45!!! Our party was separated by 5 minutes and 3 of us did not get in!! At 6:45 they were shoving us out the door. Also, make time to go through security.
Beautiful. A truly beautiful building and well worth a visit. Art awesome. Easy to get to and a really beautiful basilica to visit
beautiful. must see if in Rome lovely interior and side chapels are amazing what a place very opulent and its free
Simple Beautiful!. This is one of the most beautiful basilicas I have ever visited. It is richly decorated, well maintained, has a gorgeous altar. You have to visit at least once.
Beautiful Church. Very impressive old church with spectacular interiors. Well worth walking through and enjoying the overall impact of the decorations.
Roma. This is a stunning basilica, REMEMBER cover your legs and ladies carry a shawl to cover shoulders at ALL churches.
Beautiful church. Take the time to go visit this special church. Beautiful sealing and paintings. add it to your list.

Five blocks from Rome Termini train station: you'll need a guide for the Mosaics. Have a look at the photo of the church shown here. On top of those columns are squares of mosaics. The church is famous for having some of the earliest ever mosaics ... 5th century, and I believe one of the first to depict the Virgin Mary.In order to see the mosaics, however, you'll need to deposit 1 euros coins in order to have them lit up. Even lit, however, I would recommend a good written (or personal) guide, because without one, you won't have any idea what you are looking at (I didn't!), and there is no written information at the church.The Basilica is, unusually, open all day long (no long, lunch time break), and is open as early as 7 a.m. As others have mentioned, you will need to go through a security check to enter.

beautiful church!. What a spectacular church. Mass was being held while we visited so we didn't get to see all of the church but it's one of the best in Rome! Would definitely go back to see it again on a return visit.

Overwhelmingly beautiful. this is a vast and overpowering cathedral of cavernous proportions that still pulls off ethereal beauty and spiritual solemnity. This is one of our favourite cathedrals in Rome - definitely worth a walk up those imposing steps.

Busy, Active Church, Like a Time Machine. While full of Brazilian Tourists (we speak Portuguese so we happened on to the group and listened in!), and bus-loads of the Faithful from around the World, we gazed in wonder while priests blessed couples from the congregation, and scriptures were read in Italian and English. A museum on site contained treasures of centuries past, and it was all like travelling back in time to see the world in the 16th Century. Amazing.

Spectacular! Worth the visit . Being non-catholic, the importance of this place isn't the same for us as it would be for pilgrims visiting, but it was pretty spectacular to see! We saw a group singing in the room where there's a statue kneeling in front of a gold baby Jesus. The singing was beautiful and enhanced the spirituality of the moment. There were many different areas dedicated to different cultures (Chinese, Tagalog, Italian, etc). Definitely worth a visit!

Beautiful. Came here on our last full day in Rome. The Basilica is beautiful inside, mass was on when we got there, this does not stop you from entering as it was mostly the tourists who were taking mass. The inside was beautiful. Lots of security around Rome with soldiers being present at all the tourist sites along with the police. Before you enter you have to go through the metal detectors and your bag is x-rayed.This Basilica was not very busy which was great so you got plenty of time to look and not feel you were getting bumped into all the time. A must visit if you are in Rome.

One of my favourite church. The exterior of the building might not look like much but inside it just beautiful. My favourite area is the altar of Mother Mary (you are not able to take photos in this area but you can for the rest of the church). It is so so beautiful!

Beautiful church that is active community church. We stayed near the Basilica and were therefore able to experience it at different times of the day. It is a neighborhood church - very much used by locals. As a result, it was a joy to visit - quiet, peaceful and with few tourists. The square is touristy and best avoided as the restaurants just a street or two away are much better and cheaper.
Beautiful. This was our very first basilica so we looked at everything closely and loved the location. There was a small eatery right outside to the left. We had the best chicken dish and wine.

Totally over the top decoration, but a peaceful place of worship. We left visiting the church until our last day in Rome as we'd seen long queues of people waiting to get in on other days. We wondered why that was, but once we got in (via a bag search and armed guards, but with no charge) we understood why.The decoration in the church is totally over the top and shows the approach to the Catholic religion that was in place particularly when the church was built. Each side chapel is decorated and gilded more opulently than many whole churches, but put that on one side (if it's a bit overpowering for you as it was for me) and you can still find a peaceful spot for quiet prayer and contemplation.
Good architecture inside. gorgeous paintings all over the church, not far from Termini station. Nice interior and beautiful mozaic

Wonderful. A wonderful temple that you should defenately visit. One of the best churches of Rome. Located at the center of the city very close to Pantheon. The statues and the paintings on the walls are really great.

Visit ofth e Basilica Santa Maria Maggiore. The Basilica was very beautiful indeed, especially the frescoes and the paintings. The red Siena colour dominates the paintings, the old colours gave a shiny soft luster to the whole interior. I admire the preservation of the masterpieces and the maintenance of this building. Although people come to worship in this basilica, tourists come to visit, the serenity is maintained.
A bit rushed. But, beautiful. The place and its people are gorgeous. This is a wonderful place to enjoy a moment, take in a little snack and chase a pidgeon or two.
Beautiful mosaic. One of the four Papal Basilicas in Rome, this one features 5th century mosaics believed to be the oldest depictions of the Virgin Mary.
Beautfiul. Close to our hotel so we stopped in one afternoon. It was a lovely Basilica and not as crowded as some of the more famous churches.

Stunning. The paintings and artwork are stunning here, floor to ceilings, it takes your breathe away. Its absolutely beautiful and not to be missed. You may have to queue as they scan your bags but we only queued for about 10mins, its worth it though.

So Much To See!!!. Take your time and see all the beautiful sights. The crowds can get annoying because everyone is looking up, not where they are walking. The areas you are allowed to photograph is spectacular. Do not try to sneak photos in the restricted area, security will approach you.
Beautiful church not as crowded as the others in Rome.. We walked here from our apartment. Very short lines and not crowded. Free entry. Beautiful church that is less touristy.
Holy Moly!. What a gorgeous church! The best in Rome (besides St Peter's, I suppose!) Run, don't walk! Caravaggio heaven!
Bucket list. Beautiful to see...pictures can't possibly do it justice...too large with so much to absorbe, what craftsmanship it took to build such a beautiful building....

A stunning work of art. What a beautiful, special place. From ceiling to floor take your time and drink it in. It is true that around every corner in Rome, theres a another stunning piece of history. Be sure to include this one on your list, whether you are religious or not.

A Surprise to Me!. Before we went to the Basilica, I had no idea that it was so large. The Basilica is filled with an astonishing array of mosaics that date to the 5th century. The altar of the Sistine Chapel off the right transept of the church (not to be confused with the Sistine Chapel in the Vatican) is worth the trip alone. We went mid-morning. There were many people there but it did not take away from our experience.
Don't miss. Don't miss f you are catholic and interested in papal churches. Take your time inside to meditate and appreciate a heavenly bestowed temple

Basilica dedicated to the Blessed Virgin Mary. The Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore is the largest church in Rome dedicated to the Blessed Virgin Mary.Under the high altar of the basilica is the Crypt of the Nativity or Bethlehem Crypt, with a crystal reliquary designed by Giuseppe Valadier said to contain wood from the Holy Crib of the nativity of Jesus Christ.Here is the burial place of Saint Jerome who translated the Bible into the Latin language.The Basilica is open everyday from 7:00 am until 6:45 pm

Wow, Beautiful Church. Stunning Church, We visited early morning, Free to enter just donate inside if you wish,you will ! Locals were in a side chapel worshipping, dont be put off by the armed guard outside, and do visit the little gift shop to the side, very resonable souveniers of Rome

Beautifu and awe inspiring. We were staying across the street and I noticed that there was short line in the mornings but not later in the day. It iswell worth a wait especially if you want to walk through the Holy Door. Try not to miss this
St Mary the Major. Wow, what a find and worth your time. Tour this on your own but read up on it first so you can appreciate what you are seeing
Another stunning church. We visited late on our last day in Rome. The architecture was stunning and the visit was memorable but tended to blur with the number of churches we visited.
RIGHT NEXT TO HOSTEL!. This spot is literally like a stones throw away from the Alessandro Hostel, its in front of the Supermarket

Wonderful beautiful Church. So this was originally Roman Baths turned into a Church and it's just vast and incredible The celestial calendar across the floor is also so interesting and the Galileo information

Beautiful. Do not miss Basilica, it is fantastic. You have so much choice when it comes to churches in Rome. But this is a must visit. Apparently it was built on a sight where snow fell in August, or so the story goes. A real gem
Nice. Very nice for a quick trip or if you prefer to sit and reflect you can take your time. One of four basilicas in Rome

Unusual coffered ceiling & ancient pavements. try to attend a service here when they turn on all the lights and you hear powerful voices singing to the accompaniment of the organ. It's a beautiful church, with an interior that's distinct from other basilicas
not to miss. Santa Maria Maggiore is a great church full of architectural wonders. The marbled flooring and statues and the ceiling and also loads of paintings.

Top of The Hill. One of the four Roman Basilicas and the beautiful one. Stairway up to main door. Awesome gothic style architecture, high vaulted roof. Centrally there is sarcophagus and from there a stairway down to Sants Maria's alter, small and intimate, where you can leave prayers on the alter. Worth a second visit.

Not enough stars to rate this!!. Whilst this church is free to enter, you can pay 5 Euros to visit the most spectacular mosaics I have ever seen. The pictures I have included do not do this justice. The minimal charge includes a tour guide (ours was Emmanuel, who conducted the tour in Italian, English and Spanish). He was extremely knowledgable and answered all questions - in 3 languages. This church also has a beautiful spiral staircase, created by Bernini - worth 5 Euros on its own!!!
Magnificent . Once in a lifetime opportunity. Artwork is amazing. Holy ground. Peaceful atmosphere. A step back in time.

Incredible. This is by far the most amazing of all of the churches - including St Peter's. The artwork on the ceilings, the crypt of the nativity, the statues and paintings on the walls are better than any gallery. I cannot recommend enough visiting this church.

Amazing Basilica. Our first day in Rome we were able to attend mass here. Very interesting to hear the mass in Italian. The basilica is simply spectacular and is the largest church in Rome that is dedicated to the Virgin Mary. It was built in the 5th century. It's bell tower is the tallest in Rome. Pictures do not do it justice. There is so much beauty no matter which way you are facing. Definitely a must-see!

Gorgeous inside & out!. Santa Maria Maggiore was so close to my hotel that I walked around it so many times! It's beautiful and I'm glad that I decided to give going inside a try too because the architecture and the decorations inside are very much worth the time!
Breathtaking. An impressive basilica with exquisite mosaics. Well situated a few minutes from Termini Station on the road down to the Forum and Colosseum - well worth including on your itinerary

Surprise inside. There are 3 churches in this square and we spent time at one thinking we were in this one, until we realized as we started to pass this one that we'd missed it. How sad that would have been. Be careful on the floor because there are tombs that are carved and if you're looking up it's easy to slip (as 3 of us did). beautiful and breathtaking. a real must visit whilst in Rome, beautiful architecture and masonry, a stunning place to see and it is a lovely church

Beautiful Church. Beautifully adorned church but lacking in information. Would have been good to have a pamphlet or signs describing some of the significance of the church and it's decorations. Entry is free but you will need to cover your knees and shoulders.
Stunning!. A beautiful church with so many stunning frescos.Make sure you read up on the history of the building so it makes the trip worth it.

Huge church near Termini. One of the prettiest churches I have visited while I was in Rome with my parents. Unfortunately there was a mass, so we couldn't see all the church. One of the Great Churches in Rome. We really enjoyed our visit here. Beautiful artwork and sculptures. Very impressive. It is still just a church, but there is plenty to see here.
Great tourist location. Beautiful...old...great shape...definitely on the list of places to visit when in Rome. Great tourist attraction

Beautiful Papal Basilica. Only marginally less awesome than St Peter's, this basilica is, as the name would suggest, dedicated to the 'Mother and Child'. This is one of the most beautiful chriches in the city, nay in the world and does not suffer the same level of visitor crowding that St Peter's does at peak periods.
Highlight of Rome. Very understated from the outside and has not been altered over the years, if you cannot see Sistine Chapel be sure to see this one, no queues

Another must-see Church in Rome. There are so many churches in Rome (stating the obvious!) and we visited a LOT of them, and this one certainly stood out. The interior is jaw-dropping. If you go to Rome then you shouldn't miss this church.

Converted my partner. Stunning!. My partner was not a fan of Church sightseeing but was converted and now appreciates the beauty of religious heritage. The Basilic is something stunning from the ceiling to the crypt to the throne. Well worth the trip! Shame about tourists not respecting the visiting rules.

Added to the greatness of the church are beautiful mosaics depicting different scenes of Christ and the Virgin Mary and Old Testament events.There are many major works of art presented in the church. Don't forget to visit small and much less known yet truly astonishing Basilica di Santa Prasede nearby.
The interior beauty of this church cannot be described. Must be seen - with all its marble, religious art, chapels, and history. Each chapel is a work of art in itself

Another architectural wonder. This is a great big church and admire the architecture. They have several daily mass from 7 am till about 10 am. Well worth a visit. This large basilica on top of the hill is well worth visiting. It is a large and spectacularly decorated church. There are sometimes queues to get in, and security at the entrance, but worth the wait.

Beautiful Cathedral. first of all, planning to visit church in Rome, you need to wear proper clothes meaning, no shorts, and no sleeveless shirts (for both Genders)second, it is an AMAZING, BEAUTIFUL piece of ART!, the cathedral is beautiful inside out, the ceiling is enough to impress you! one of the most beautiful churches in the world!
Impressive. We visited during a sermony and the ️️Atmosphere was magical.So interesting to see and experience.As we love architecture and art this church is a must see in Rome.

what more can one say. Mary Major (an English name for the Basilica) has a fascinating history and is a must visit to pay respect to the Manger if nothing else. You can miss this holy relic if you do not know where it is located, go down the stairs before the alter.
Must see. Another must see site in Rome - one of the seven churches of Rome founded in the 5th century. Near Termini.

Magnificent. Came across this amazing church quite by accident whilst walking to the Colosseum. It is absolutely staggering - so beautiful. We arrived on Sunday morning just as mass was about to start - such pomp and ceremony to see. There is plenty of art and treasures to see, and I believe an author is buried there.There is an armed guard and a handbag search and security scanner at the entrance ....

The second best Basilica in Rome. After the St Peter's Basilica, this is the second biggest church which in the city which is located in the city center. We had entered the place during the closing hours, so didn't get to spend too long inside the church. But within the short time one can see the enormous size and the beauty of this amazing church.
Beautiful. This is one of the many, many beautiful old churches in Rome. Worth a stop if you're near or in the area.
Stunning. This place is simply stunning. Well worth a visit. Not crowded so plenty time to read all about the history. 5 minutes walk from Termini station
Beautiful Church. If time is limited and you have to choose just one church to visit in Rome, this one is a must. Very spacious and a lovely atmosphere
Overwhelming. The most amazing church in Rome with a history of pilgrims coming from over the world. Must enter throught the holy door.
Worth seeng.. There are so many fantastic buildings here. This is yet just another. Worth going to and it is on the 'hop on hop off ' tours.

Beautiful Basilica!!!. This is such a beautiful place. is like walking through a museum. It has a huge nave and side aisles cover with gorgeous mosaics. If you visit Rome, this is a place you should stop by.
Stunning Church. The biggest church in Rome was great to see. Absolutely magnificent. They provided white fabric to cover shoulders and knees which was handy.
Stunning. Another monument I didn't expect to go to. I was walking past it and it catched my eye. Decided to go inside and wasn't disappointed!

Stunning church. Went for 9:00 Mass on a Sunday, which was like a locals' Mass in a side chapel. As it ended the 10:00 Mass in the basilica itself was beginning - high pageantry. Just a stunning church.

Beautiful mosaics. The mosaics on the portico are worth the trip along, but inside it is quit beautiful as well. As it is one of the "five door" churches during Jubilee year, expect large crowds and tight security, We were glad to see the security.

Spiritual !. When I drove from Raleais Due i Laghi to Rome, the taxi driver told us that there are more than 900 churches in Rome. I visited some of them. Every single of them is so unique! This one commands our presence with great reverence ! Beauty in every corner of the chapel and the entire atmosphere was so great even for an agnostic like me! If you are a believer, then I am not confused that you might have tons of more greater experience than me!

Go see this!. An amazing basilica - often empty - and just crazy with art. We were fortunate to stay right next to this, or we might never have taken the time to go - it was absolutely stunning inside and out.

Magnificient. This is the protector saint of the romans and the largestmarian catholic church in Rome. Canonized by the Pope Gregorius XVI by the bule celestina Regina. Although is not inside the vatican limits , belongs to them by international laws. A must in Rome

My Favourite Church in Rome. My favourite basilica in Rome, quieter than St Peter's. Small queue for the security checks, but once inside (remember to dress appropriately, it's a sign of respect). Beautiful paintings, frescos, very serene atmosphere. Situated quite near to our hotel, near the Termini, well worth a look at night when lit up.
nice mall. inside take a break from the street and enjoy top shelf coffee and food the shopping is just a few small specialty shops
A MUST-SEE!!. This Basilica is another must-see Basilica in Rome. Tucked away in a neighborhood like moset Roman churches and basilicas, it is an amazing work of art (and works of art within).
Amazing church. Queues went quickly - very interesting building inside. Quite busy but did not detract from our visit.

Put This Church On Your Tour List. St. Mary Major is a beautiful basilica, and is well worth the visit.St. Mary Major is impressive for many reasons, but among the most noteworthy are the beautiful 4th century mosaics in the apse, the amazing baptistery, etc. The area around altar is most amazing, however. The altar is flanked by two ancient red columns. Walking downs below the altar, you are confronted with a fantastically lifelike sculpture of Pope Pius IX in prayer. He is facing the reliquary containing pieces of the manger from Bethlehem. Below the sculpture is the grave of St. Jerome, the 5th century saint who translated the Bible from Greek into Latin.Back on the main floor, to one side of the altar is the grave of Bernini. I was expecting that the grave of this artist, known for his sculptures all over Rome, would be ornate. It took me a while to find it since his memorial is simply inscribed into the steps.The church is beautiful, but luckily, unlike St. Peters, is not so crowded by tourists and still has the proper contemplative ambiance for prayer one expects in a basilica.This basilica should be on your list of places to visit in Rome. It is convenient to the metro, the main train station (Termini Station), and the main taxi station (all being about two blocks away)
Amazing church!!. If you like to visit churchs, this is a must go!! Its not St. Peters but its worth it, and good attraction for a rainy day!

Great surprise. Not planned in our visit, we got there by chance and went in to hide from the sun. Big surprise, the basilica is huge and amazing, with a very rich decoration, statues, and chapels. A must see!

A must. Second most important basilica in town. Mind blowing architecture. I spent 2 hours inside taking pictures. The variety of details is overwhelming. I'm not sure if there is a guided visit option- to explain all the art pieces inside - that would come in handy. Definitely a must see when in Rome - especially that it's just 5 minutes away walk from the termini train station.

STUNNING. Really good. A must visit.This is not on the scale of St. Peter's or the Sistine chapel in terms of building but it is an absolute must if you appreciate how amazing something like this is to have been built so long ago

In the Heart of Rome. The Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore is one of my favourite churches in Rome. I was fortunate to visit it during the Jubilee Year of Mercy I was able to walk through the Holy door and attend a Sunday mass there. It was a surreal experience with the mass in Italian and the wonderful music accompanying the mass.
Don't miss this basilica.. It's away from the central (more famous) sights, but it is impressive. Exceptional mosaics, and it has Bernini's tomb. Worth a visit!

Heavenly wonder.. It was austere, impressive, amazing. A must see when in Rome. After seeing St. Peter's this was just as magical and pristine, although much smaller than St. Peter's. But fewer tourist to distract you.
Peaceful. In spite of the numbers of people around, on this visit it felt more like a church. This time there was seating, and several services taking place including a funeral.
One of the finest. Although it can't match St Peters, this is a gorgeous church with beautiful 16th frescos. If you are staying near Termini, this is a short walk and well worth seeing.

Beautiful early Christian basilica. One of the 4 papal basilicas, and typically impressive with stunning mosaics, Dedicated to the Virgin Mary, hence the name. A must see. This place was amazing. A nice blend of old Roman architecture and a church. The inside is a beautiful church and the outside a Roman Temple.

Beautiful Church. We visited this Church during our first visit to Rome in mid May 2016. This is really a must see for anyone interested in seeing some of Rome's most beautiful places of worship or for anyone interested in a historical beautiful building.Walking into this Church is breathtaking, we were lucky in that the crowds were very small on the afternoon we visited which allowed both a great visit and some precious time to reflect on your own whilst there.
Nice and quiet. Just popped in to relax and get away from the noise of the city. As all churches, beautiful artwork and if you're lucky you might get a piece of a service. Very nice.

A great place to relax!!. Outside the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore there is a fountain where you can sit and observe every corner of the church!!! So relaxing.... especially at night!! It's worth it!

Best part of Vatican area but crowded. We visited the Vatican in early May. Saw the museum, Sistine Chapel, Basilica, and St. Peter's Square. Beautiful!. Amazon just by attraction that was close to the hotel. Didn't have it on our 'must see' list but we are very glad we took the time.

Second best church in rome. Behind only San Giovanni Laverna. Don't miss this one! Not crowded,beautiful and spiritual. Kind of "in the hood" compared to other churches,but still safe and easy to get to.
beautiful basillica. far less crowded and more beautiful than st peters in my opinion!Fantastic medieval mosaics, we went on a sunday and heard the choir and saw mass.fantastic

Beautiful and much quieter. This Basilica is as beautiful and breathtaking as St Peter's but so much quieter.From one side (steps and rotunda) it looks closed but when you walk around, towards the pillar in the square, it's stunning.
Pieces of the crib of baby Jesus. The area under the alter houses a peice of the crib of baby Jesus. This is a beautiful church. Don'the miss the baptistry in a side area, it is spectacular.
Beat titular Church. The inside of this church on a piazza in Rome is well worth a visit:.Beautiful marble all over. Floor was unique. Right near Termini station so it is quite easy to access.

A stunning building.... Amongst all of the beautiful attractions to see in Rome this church is one of the most incredible. It's presence in the crowded street is intimidating and even from outside it is stunning. Once inside the highly decorated interior is awe inspiring. Like with all of Rome's churches entry is free. One of the better Gems in Roma. While walking from the train station I stopped in here and marveled at the beauty. It is free to walk around and I don't recommend paying for a tour. The church is very nice. This is lovely to look at, even if you are not into the religious side of things, the structure is impressive and nice to look at.

Church dedicated for Mother Mary. This is the church dedicated to mama Mary . And it's one of the 4 major basilica in rome. The solemnity of the church is the best. And this basilica is also have a jubilee door. "Porta santa" one of the best architecture in the world.

Beautiful. The building is beautiful and well preserved. The artwork and intricate ceiling, mosaic window designs are fantastic. This is the largest Catholic Marian church in Rome and one of the ancient basilicas in Rome. Has a Holy Door as well.Entrance if free. Recommending this to all type of travelers.

Relic of Jesus's manger. Go to see the lovely mosaic work, but don't forget to go under the altar to see the relic of the manger in which Jesus lay. You can make a donation there for a mass to be said for a loved one.

Well worth the visit. An wide blend of styles from Romanesque to Baroque.. Well worth the visit. An wide blend of styles from Romanesque to Baroque. It's in a busy circle, but anchors a quiet part of town.
Wonderful. It is an other wonderful Basilica to visit when in Rome. It has amazing artwork, a very nice building.

See a piece of Jesus' manger. Saw a piece of Jesus's manger encased beneath the main altar. The ceiling is nice as well. Free to enter, and the usual rules for covering up apply -although I saw some people in long shorts that go up to the knees. Worth returning to see it. Another beautiful Basilica we came to it the previous day from the back X it had barriers around it so we thought it was closed.We returned there was a mass there so we stayed for that. Going as a couple is good as you can make decisions X not having to worry that you might be upsetting other people.
beautiful. Beautiful building with amazing religious artwork and status. There is a stairway to a stunning alter with a small amount of setting for prayers. Well worth a visit

WOW!. The Basilica of Saint Mary Major is a beautiful building. When you walk inside, it takes your breath away. We took a Vatican tour that included this and three other Basilicas in Rome. It is worth the trip to go there for sure.

Stunning!. From outside does not look very appealing.

A must.

2nd Only to St Peters. This is a real favorite of mine been here on three separate occasions. Love the stain glass window and the story of the church.

Beautiful Church. It was one of the many churches within walking distance of our hotel. Loved visiting the old churches. And the Plazas around this area , all within walking distance!!!
Bueatiful. Can be quite easily missed. Definitely a must if you like Basilicas, worth looking for and definitely a treasure.
Room with a view.... Lovely. Missed the Pope by just two days. Great central meeting point. Directly adjacent to Mecenate Palace Hotel. Easy access.

Nice church - shame about the crowds. Actually it is a very nice church though I come from the heathen school of once you've seen one basilica its quite hard to get your socks blown off by the next one. Its got everything a basilica should have. That's fine. Next one now...
wonderful Basilica. It is situated near Termini Station and also very near to Colosseum and Roman Forum. The architectural beauty is amazing.

Beautiful Basilica. In order to get the most out of this visit I suggest you go with a tour. There is plenty history which you will not have access too unless you read up on it before visiting. Very calming!

My favorite Basilica next to St. Peters.. This is a truly beautiful basilica and it is easy to see why the pope is so drawn to it. We were honored to go thru the Holy Door there and I would recommend anyone on a pilgrimage as we were not to miss this.

Such a shame about surroundings!. This Basilica is stunning, yet my rating is low due to exterior issues. The entire church is surrounded by ugly chain link fencing to secure the building and funnel everyone to a police monitored entrance. This is a shame, as it takes away the beauty of the square and surrounding steps. You must wait in line to have items scanned and checked by security guards in order to gain entry. The original large congregation seating has been replaced with plastic chairs which also takes away from the grandeur of this basilica. The alters and side areas remain quite impressive, although some are roped off and the public is not allowed entry. This attraction is worthy of a stop, but the exterior distractions and security hassle makes this a less than stunning attraction.
Amazing Church. We had to pass through security to enter, but it was worth it for the amazing architecture and beauty inside. Definitely recommend.

Stopped off to visit on route, glad we did...... The Basilica which was not on our list of places to visit but as we passed it we decided to go in. Free entry but there is a security check which did not take long. Beautiful artwork and architecture so well worth our detour for half an hour.
A cathedral that should be visited. You see many cathedrals in Rome. This is one of those that should be in the plan. The cathedral is big and interesting and its area is nice too.
Hidden Gem. This is worth the visit as the walls and ceilings of the Basilica are so beautifully decorated and time is well spent viewing them

Santa Maria Maggiore. nice christian cathedral, very close to Termini railway station rich of paintings and sculptures. Recently Pope Francesco wanted to guest some poor people during the cold winter.
There are many churches in Rome. This is not inspiring from the exterior. A lovely surprise awaits you when you walk through the doors. It's a must see.

Absolutely wonderful!. This is one of the wondrous , but unsung ,Basillicas in Rome!The interior is just breathtaking, and there are just so many things to see,including a fabulous sculpture by Bernini. This is the largest church in Rome dedicated to the Virgin Mary, and has its own Holy Door. As this a jubilee year , of Mercy, anybody who enters via this door can obtain "indulgences", having fulfilled certain obligations.You need to research this.A brilliant experience especially if you get a guide.

Really worth the visit . This place was need our hotel and so glad we went in. Try to go Early or late to avoid the queue at security. It is free unless you wish to go into the vaults which I did not so I cannot say how they are.But the main church is mesmerising. If is hard not to be in awe of the surroundings, the paintings, the grottos, the ceilings and what is most beautiful is to watch all the masses going in on in the individual chapel and areas and to see people so respectful of the areas. It is one of the few churches I visited in Rome where I felt it still felt like a religious place and not just an attraction. I still felt connected to this beautiful place spiritually unlike some of the many others I saw.

Incredible interior. When you visit Rome you do eventually become immune to all the marvels, but the interior of this church definately has the wow factor. The intricate mosaics which adorn the sides of the church are breathtaking
Santa Maria a living museum. Attend church, mass, services if you are able. The beauty is inspiring. Photos not allowed, but were taken anyway by tourists.
Beautiful. Beautiful place- very elegant and elaborate- worth a visit. Lots to look at and take photos of. Definitely go.
Beautiful church. Rome has no shortage of beautiful churches and this one doesn't disappoint. The lighting in the afternoon allows for some great photo opportunities.

You figure it out ..... Listen: I have no idea how many times this church has been renovated. Fifth Century should mean Romanesque, but it doesn't look Romanesque. The tower has a Gothic feel, and the rest bears traces of Renaissance and even Baroque additions. A quick search yielded no meaningful results. You try it. That said, the structure is fascinating. Walk around it, inspect it from all sides. It's worth it.

Quite an impressive basilica, on par with the other majors. We took a tour of this and the other three majors basilicas, and unfortunately this was at the end of the day, and due to traffic we were running behind schedule so the time here was a bit shorter than it should have been, but we were able to see the place.It is quite grand, and definitely on par with the others - the only downside is that it is right in the middle of Rome, and as such it is both easy to get to and best by horrendous traffic at times.
Another amazing building. We were staying close by to this church and passed it everything we went anywhere. There was always something different to see every time you saw it.great architecture

One of Rome's most magnificent Basillicas. I love old churches. But there's a difference between a church and a historic basilica. This is the latter. When you visit Santa Maria Maggiore, you feel like you're walking into a sacred space, no matter what you believe. Maybe it's the classic architecture. Maybe it's the statues of the saints. Maybe it's a higher authority.

Wow! . Could not believe we were staying in a hotel so close to this almost as magnificent as St Peter's Basilica place! Wow!
Could see the back of the basilica from our hotel room. Lovely outside and inside. Visit and see for yourself!

Missed this my first trip to Rome.... So I really didn't want to miss it the second time around. Walking along Via Cavour, you see this huge church but i didn't realize that I was viewing he back of the church. There a beautiful column with St Mary on in the front of the church and a very nice little piazza as well. Definitely should visit, despite the security checkpoint...

Beautiful church. . The Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore is located less than 2 minute walk from where we are staying, therefore is literally on our doorstep. How lucky we are. We didn't enter the basilica until this afternoon when we decided that with the entry being free and the weather being cloudy, we would regret it if we didn't go inside. We are very glad that we did. The outside is beautiful, but that is nothing compared to the wonders that are inside. Amazing sculptures around the church and the side chapels along with beautiful paintings. Remember, with most of the churches in Rome/ Vatican, you need to look at the floor, the walls AND the ceilings in order to see everything the buildings have to offer

Impressive. Another of the major Basilicas in Rome, St. Mary Major has some of the most impressive mosaics found anywhere. We happened to be there on a Sunday when they were beginning the procession through the Jubilee door and it was really something special.

Spectacular place. This is a large basilica, it is free to visit which is nice compared to others which charge. It is a very ornate place with lots of amazing statues and pieces of art. There were services going on in two little areas of the basilica and there were priests taking confession in others. Well worth a visit
A glorious church. So beautiful with wonderful art and well-preserved mosaics. The church is huge and awe-inspiring. A bonus was it even had a public restroom!
Impressive . Just a short queue with bag search to get in but it's well worth it. The interior of this church is magnificent. From the ancient mosaics to the gilded ceilings, it is very impressive.
Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore. Beautiful looking church! We took a day and visit the top 4 cathedrals in Rome, and this is one of them!
Impressive. We visited during morning mass. The service was excellent and the choral singing was beautiful. Impressive to see
Beware!. All the Major Basilicas this year being Holy Year are on High alert so there are scanners and often long queues.

Magnificent. What a wonderful Church as well as a wonderful building. It feels very peaceful and inviting you to take your time to look at all the intimate areas around the perimeter of the building. We went early - 8.30am and went straight if only worshippers in there. Later we noticed a queue as we walked past.

beautiful. This was just across from our hotel and a very useful landmark for finding our way back. Armed guards outside very friendly. Inside and outside are beautiful, and free entry. Actual nuns and monks and stuff go here. We went back twice because it was so peaceful.

What Many Ceilings Probably Looked Like. ...before all the gold was stripped off. This basilica was saved and restored and denoted a Major basilica as it was used by popes. As such, all the gold used decoratively was saved - the ceiling shines, the nave and everywhere you see original gold finishings. I happened in on a mass, which was lovely and accompanied by a choral performance. If you're in the area, it's well worth a stop in to see.
Basilica di Santa maggiore . Beautiful looking church inside and out. I am not a religious person but love the architecture and fine detail of the decor.
Loved it. There are few churches in Rome that disappoint and this one is great, it is lot up by afternoon light streaming in the windows and great pictures can be taken.
Beautiful!. We accidentally stumbled into this church after visiting the nearby museum. I'm glad we did, a truly beautiful piece of Roman history.

Ooh. Cards on the table, I'm not a religious person by any stretch of the imagination, but you don't have to be to admire this mesmerising temple! I dare you to try and walk in and think anything other than "oooh wow". It's beautiful, so much detail to miss. It goes without saying that when admiring a place of worship as a tourist, be sure to be respectful of both the place and the people worshiping there- don't be noisey and don't flash your camera!

Must see as a pilgrim. The Third most visited site in Rome after the Colleseum and Forum. Don't miss relics of the manger of the Christ Child and an interesting museum under the basilica containing relics
Beauty. Beautiful church with an outstanding richness. A must see while in rome although a little far from the centre

Really beautiful basilica. We visited this Basilica the day after going around St Peters and we thought it might be an anti climax after such grandeur however we were wrong. This really is a beautifully place and should not be missed off your visit. The tour buses stop outside so easy to get to.
tight security. Lots of paintings and statues to see. With explanation to all the artwork and less crowd, it is better than a museum.
Beautiful Church but not top 10 attraction in Rome. Beautiful Church, worth a visit if you have time, but its not a "must see" in Rome if you are not a catholic. Golden ceiling!
Another must see when in Rome. there are so many basilica's in Rome you would have to live there for a month or two to see them all, but this is one of the must see places in Rome.

Beautiful and Awe Inspiring, A Must See in a Jubilee Year. This was an absolutely beautiful basilica, and one of the four major basilicas in Rome (which is significant in this Jubilee Year, as they each have a Holy Door that one can enter only in a Jubilee Year) The architecture was magnificent, the altar was just beautiful, and the doors were quite impressive too. You do have to go through a metal detector to enter, but the wait is well worth it. I think this was one of the prettiest churches I saw in Rome, and I did visit quite a few!

Well worth a visit. I used to stay in a hotel less that a block from this magnificent structure and have visited it on several occasions and highlyrecommend a visit if you have time during your stay in Rome.

Stunning interior. The Basilica was just across from our hotel (Boscolo Exedra) and is an old, not very impressive exterior. We found they were having Mass in English and decided to attend. When we walked in we were stunned to find a magnificent interior, belying the exterior. Definitely worth a visit.

Lovely but dark. The church is impressive but rather dark when the sky outside is overcast. On my first visit last month, somebody turned on lights briefly and the lovely ceiling and walla were visible. Then suddenly they were turned off and dark prevailed. We weng back today hoping for more light, but it started raining and the sunlight disappeared. The human eye can adjust, but if you want good pix go on a sunny day.

Beautiful, original and uncrowned. This church is off the beaten path and worth a visit. From the outside it's not that impressive but the inside is very ornate with gorgeous ceilings, Windows, and more.

Off the tour bus and there it was.. This church is without doubt a must see. The beauty is without any argument out standing. Marie said a few prays and I don't know how many candles she lit. When we return to Rome, we will revisit.
leonardo's humour. This Basilica shelter several materpieces. Among them is a statue of Moise with little horns made by Leonardo da Vinci. You will see the St pete's chains also. Free. take 30-45min
Glorious place of worship. We stayed opposite this beautiful building. A very special place to visit, quite stunning architecture and workmanship.
Beautiful church. Very sunning architecture and amazing stained glass. The frescoes are sensational and in all a feast for the senses

Often over looked but well worth you time.. You should not miss this church. Outstanding inside and out.
Note: You must go through a medal detector to get in.
Also if you use the Hope off and Hope on bus, this is well worth stopping for. We were there for mass and were amazed at the number of people walking in and out during the service.
Beautiful basilica. There are so many churches in Rome, but it was great to visit Santa Maria Maggiore; the colonnaded nave especially was beautiful.
Amazing. Amazing church can enter for free no guide required, art and architecture worth the visit. Central location easy for tourists

Bring your binoculars. Be sure to take a pair of binoculars so that you can have a really good look at the fantastic 5th century AD mosaics surrounding the high altar. It's worth getting a good guide book to understand the pictures, which represent the Annunciation and the main events of Christ's childhood. I particularly like the cute groups of horses gazing up at Jerusalem and Bethlehem at the bottom left and right. Also don't forget to have a good look at the sumptuous 15th century gilded coffered ceiling by probably Antonio Sangallo, said to have been made with the first shipments of gold from the Americas.
Wow!. Don't miss it if you're in Rome, the Santa Maria Basillica was just stunning - so much gold! Well worth a visit.
worth a visit. stopped in here on the off chance from hop on / off bus, free into public nice area beautiful church spend maybe half hour
Churches of Rome. Went to Sunday Mass. Downside was the security lines to get into the Basilica, but once inside was worth the wait. Beautiful frescos.

the view outside is spectacular. desite the apparent run down locality, the Basilica is amazing inside with the tombs of multiple saints and Popes in the side chapels. The apse and sanctuary area are breathtaking and decoration is majestic despite some opinions that all the gold should be sold etc.....
Golden delights. Staggeringly beautiful. Put it on your to do list when in Rome. The golden ceiling is jaw droppingly beautiful

Beautiful. So very very breathtaking! This place is a must see on a trip to Rome! It's free to enter once you get past the security (your bag and your self goes through a scanner) make sure you are not wearing any revealing clothes, you must be covered up when you go in! Took loads of photos! And went into the little museum at the end, €3 entry! Loved it!Hopefully will get time to go back again before we leave!
Huge and beautiful. Very huge cathedral and very beautiful. If you are interested in beautiful buildings and churches it is a must
week end visit ti Rome. A beautiful church, even if you are not interested in religion the architecture is stunning worth a visit

Wonderful church. This is the second largest basilica in Rome, a building with major historical and cultural significance. Do not miss it. Even if you have limited time in Rome, it is worth the visit.
Pictures do not do this beauty justice. I had seen many pictures of the Santa Maria Basilica, but I was taken aback by its beauty. Make time to see this church. You will not be disappointed.

Better than St Peters!. Only a personal opinion, but I think this church outshines St Peter's Basilica in many ways. Whilst both are free, access to Santa Maria is easier at the moment as the security forces are at large throughout Rome and queues are ridiculous at the better known sites. The interior of the church has to be seen to be believed.
Beautiful. Our favourite basilica in our time in Rome besides St Peter's. A very nice experience although do know that whilst the Basilica is free there is a charge to go into the tombs.

Must see. The church was erected in the place where the snow fell in August(!) - that is what the legend says. The pop of that time drew by himself the dimensions of the future to be church, that enlarged in size tremendously later. Some key features to see:Santa Porta open in 2016- jubilee year. The tomb of Bernini( famous sculptor)The icon of Maria who saved RomanThe statue of Peace- one can put the notice with request to ask for the peace. Awesome mosaics works, just miraculous. It is free but take into account that there's a control gate, so you might stay in line for a while.

Worth making a detour to visit.. A most beautiful church and a very ancient one as well. It is worth allowing a couple of hours to visit and to read up about the rich art work and history surrounding this building.
Beautiful Church. Beautiful church that is definetly worth the visit. Like most churches in Rome it is free, but you need some time to get in because of the bags-control.

Serenity and grandeur . Awe inspiring architecture and calming serenity. With the free iPhone app, you can spend hours going through all the prayer rooms and submerge in the surreal history of Catholic Church
Rome's 3rd most important church. Really enjoyed this stop. The Pope at Prayer in the lower level before alter was beautiful. The exterior was awesome at night when upper balconies were lit up
A must see. Santa Maria Maggiore is one of the Pope Basilikas and a must see. You can also go upstairs with a guide to see the Mosaics in the Loggia.
last minute visit. I went there last day in Rome and it deserves to stay at least two hours if you wanna see every single icon they have confession rooms with different languages it is really amazing

Santa Maria Maggiore. Easy to miss, but you won't forgive yourself. Stunningly beautiful, feeling if reverence, and peace. Look around in awe. Remember, it is a house of God, dress sensibly, shirts and mini skirts etc are not appropriate.

Beautiful Church - You Have to See It. This is a beautiful church. There is a security line which did not take a long time when we went but when we passed by yesterday in the afternoon was very long so if you can go early. We also found it of value to take the private tour of other parts of the church not open to public. We didn't get into the museum, because the Pope arrived and we got a great view. Talk about being in the right place at the right time!!!!! When you finish walk down to the other end of Merulana and see Basilica di San Giovanni in Laterano.. Stop at La Cuccuma half way down for some great pizza.
Beautiful Structure. We attended Mass at the Basilica. Lovely service, beautiful paintings and architecture. So happy we had this opportunity. If you plan to attend Mass plan on an hour and a half.

Most Beautiful Church I have ever seen.. If you are planning a trip to Rome, you must see Santa Maria Maggiore basilica. Mosaic floors…carved marble columns… gilt ceilings…stunning art work, both paintings and statues. Wear respectful clothing—no sleeveless shirts, tank tops, shorts, etc. They will make you wrap yourself in plastic sheeting if you show up in clothes that are not acceptable. The church was holding mass in several of the small side chapels when we were there. Do not intrude, take pictures, or walk in on a mass. Priests hear confession openly at booths along the church's side walls. Do not take pictures of anyone making a confession. If you wonder what you will see, check out Google images for this church. Absolutely stunning and wonderful.

Find ancient murals behind newer construction. This is a great church. It's worth seeing. Unless you're a scholar or worshipper, I don't know why you'd go back. Front has ancient murals/fresco behind newer - still centuries-old - portico. Anywhere you can find oldest frescos,murals, etc., is worth the visit. Expect crowds at entrance and they seem to vanish inside huge space. I burn out on churches pretty quickly because I'm not Catholic and I'm not a student of architecture or the Baroque. The ancient foundations of oldest churches remain fascinating for their use, not their age.

Architecture and artistic Monument. This is the oldest and probably the most beautiful and biggest church in Rome. The architecture and the paintings inside the church are marvelous. For more details about the place can be found in wiki link. I will provide little more details on how to reach this place and things which we should or shouldn't do. This is to help fellow travelers when they plan to visit this place.Its easy to reach this place. The nearest metro station is Lepanto on metro line A towards Batitstini. From the station exit its around 20 minutes walk. You could reach faster if you are not going with a baby stroller :). This place is free or no ticket required to visit this place. Therefore expect a long queue at the entrance. We went in the morning around 10AM and the queue was not too long. So I would advice to reach the place by 10am if you want to avoid any queue. Since its the entrance place for the Vetican city, so you will be greeted by many tourists guides (not sure government authorized or not) who will scare you saying the current wait time is 3-4 hours, which might be correct at the peak time. And they will ask you for few euros (40 probably) and give you entry to the Vetican city along with museum entry. We didn't bother to listen them and went straight to the entry of the Basilica and found hardly 20 minutes of wait time. There is separate place to keep the baby stroller as its not allowed inside. While returning you can book tickets for Vetican city and museum from their counters only. So if you plan to go inside Vetican city this is the place where you book the tickets. Our overall experience was really good and we would recommend this place. Our little one also liked it and she was relaxed without any tantrums. Should you have any specific queries, do write to me and i'll try my best to assist you.

An imposing structure. One of the Rome’s four patriarchal basilicas (with San Giovani in Laterano, San Paolo fuori le mura and San Pietro) is a blend of different architectural eras. It was built in the 5th century and it retains the core of the original structure, despite several additional reconstructions and the damage during the earthquake in 1348. The design of the building resembles the plan of an ancient imperial basilica with the beautiful mosaics from the 5th century in its interior.

Beautiful church. we were fortunate enough to attend a Sunday Mass there but I was surprised by the security check to enter...definitely allow more time, the line was pretty long. Beautiful church not to be missed.

Fine architecture. The best view of the church is from the Mencante hotel across the way. You can view it from their rooftop bar/restaraunt, or if you were fortunate as I was a few years back, from the window of my top floor room. Either way, gorgeous at sunset.
Nice church. We stopped here to explore as it was just down the street from our hotel and really appreciated this lovely church on our Pilgrims' tour of Rome using Rick Steves guide.

Wonderful basilica. This was just around the corner from my hotel and was one of the first places I visited in Rome. Such a massive, beautiful place, and at night is illuminated for some great photos from outside.

Breathtaking. My favourite church in Rome. There is something very special about this church. It is incredibly beautiful with a fantastic ceiling, great marble statues etc but it also has a very strong spiritual feel which I find missing in some of Rome's 'great' churches.

A very nice holy place 😇. Once through security, the place is lovely and provides many photo opportunities. Some places restrict photos being taken but that was only two side chapels, the rest you can take pictures! If you are religious or not it is quite a nice place to visit

Beautiful Church but a long walk from all other sites. This church was incredibly beautiful, but if you are planning on walking everywhere during your holiday, it should be noted that this church is quite far from other attractions, and the neighborhood leading up to it is not really nice to walk through. If you have a few days in Rome I would recommend visiting- if you have less time, then St. Peters + the Vatican is the better bet!

Beautiful Basiica. Said to be the first Basilica dedicated to Mother Mary. It holds Jesus' crypt under the altar. The details of the architecture is amazing. Stained glass, mozaic, pantings in the ceiling, ornaments of the chapels on left and right side, all are truly work of art.
Glorious. We intended to visit, but just came upon it quite by chance. Majestic, interesting, full of great treasures. Appropriate security at the entrance.
Must in 2016. 2016 is declared holy year by the pope. Lots of people there. Do not miss the 4 basilica's and their holy door.
Santa Maria Marriore. Lovely church, free to enter, good security on the door that didn't hold us up much but I expect when it's busy there can be quite a queue.
Beaultiful church. It's worth visiting. One of the four biggest Basilica in Rome. Very beautiful, a lot of art works. They organise some tours also and it's possible to walk up the tower.

Beautiful. We had to queue a while to get in, but it was totally worth the wait. This church is stunning and there is so much to see at every turn. Take your time to walk round and take it all in. Make sure this is on your list of things to do whilst in Rome.
Old Roman Basilica. Beautiful Basilica, worth visiting as it is perfectly decorated despite its size! It is not far away from Termini station, and you can reach it with metro.
Do not miss !. Fabulous church. Comparable to St. Peters in fact. We visited twice as we didn't feel we had actually been able to see everything on the first visit.

Next to Train station. Very easy to get to, lots of small places to eat or pick up necessary items nearby, is a pick up spot for hop on hop off tour bus, 2 companies use the stop. Nice place to sit on steps and people watch.

Non-descript outside but inside - wow!!!. Visited this beautiful Basilica on a whim. From the outside it doesn't look much at all but just wait until you get inside. It is truly beautiful and you can't help but feel a sense of peace. After walking all the way round and looking at the individual chapels, took a seat and just contemplated.Definitely a must to visit if in Rome. Outside there is now airport style seaching/scanning but no queue at all when we visited.
Perhaps the most beautiful church in the world.. Of course, the church would save it's best for the Mother of God! Don't hesitate. Go! I do hopre to get back soon.

Breathtaking. Our family (kids included) were awed by this church. The ceiling, frescoes, sculptures, etc. are a lot to take in -- so incredibly impressive. Easily one of our favorite churches, out of the many that we visited in Rome. Don't be daunted by the security line; it moves quickly.

Surprised. Iznenadjena. I was very surprised by the size and beauty of this cathedral. Something you should definitely visit if you have time.Bila sam vrlo iznenadjena velicinom i lepotom katedrale. Nesto sto definitivno treba posetiti ako imate vremena.

Another beautiful Roman church!. All the Roman Basilicas are beautifully decorated, and this is one of the best. The walls, ceilings and floors are all delightfully covered in pictures and decorative detail. Well worth a visit!
Beautiful. This is accessible on foot from the main termini. Security is tight with bags checked through a scanner. Well worth a visit.
Again why leave any of them out. All part of what makes Rome Roma you don't have to be religious to appreciate the shear splendour of it all
Wonderful!. As with all the churches and cathedrals you can see works of art and fabulous stone work. Beautiful in every direction, as always.....look up!

Free and close by other attractions. The church is beautiful. You'll recognize it by the elephant statue out front. It's free to go in, a great attraction for a rainy day. It's nearby the Trevi fountain, pantheon and piazza Navona. And via del Corso, if you want to shop. If you only have a day or two, this is the area to be in.
stunning basilica. This basilica is full of wonderful mosaics along the nave and apse and is full of atmosphere. highly recommended.

Beautiful church. If you have the time to go a little outside the historic centre, this church is worth visiting! It's near the Termini station, about 5-10 minutes walk. There is a line to get in but security checks go very quickly. We had to wait for less than 10 minutes to get in. Church is really beautiful, opulent....Sit down on one of the benches and take in all the impressions that you get. Put a coin in the machine to turn on the lights :-)

Make sure to listen to the audio guide (located in the back) - really brings it alive. The mosaics alone are worth the walk to get here. It is a grand and lovely basilica with an interesting history. In the back of the church (opposite the altar) are a few small audio players. It's definitely worth the 2 euro coin to get to hear the history of the church, the art, and the people involved (two earpieces, so you and a companion can both enjoy it).Do know that, because of this church's importance and tourist appeal there is a security checkpoint that you must pass through -- your bag will be examined. No biggie, but when you approach from most of the angles it looks like the church is closed. Enter by the tall column with the Virgin Mary on top.

Underrated!. Our tour book just said this church had nice and old mosaics. This description grossly underappreciates the amazing art and chapels located in its interior. This is a Vatican church, so it has TONS of tourists, but it is still wonderful. It is so large you don't feel crowded. Truly beautiful and moving
Beautiful church. One of many churches to see in Roma. They are all very similar, yet beautiful in their own ways. Worth the time exploring ... wish I knew Italian for reading.

One of the Four Important Papal Churches. A beautiful church with gold coffered ceiling. Bernini is buried here. Paolina, Napoleons sister is also buried here as well as Pope Sixtus V. There is a reliquary that supposedly holds pieces from the crib of Jesus. A wonderful church to visit and was the church that Pope Francis gave his first address when he was made pope. There are 4 papal churches and this is often referred to as the "Mother Church." Some of these papal churches actually more important than St. Peters.
Stunning. All of the Basilicas are beautiful, and all are free to the public. I suggest you go into everyone you pass. They all are a bit different, and have some amazing art!
"The Best church". Each and every inch is worth watching and spending time. i would suggest even a day is not enough if you are an art lover.

Beautiful Church. A must see but try to go early to avoid the crowds. It is open from 7am to 7pm .We were there before 9 as we were staying nearby but by 9,30 there were lots of people.There is a security to go through but should not put you off a visit. Rome has many lovely churches but this has to be one of the best. Good views at night when it is lit up. There is a cafe opposite so read the reviews Antico Caffe Santamaria.
Quaint. Lovely little square to relax in and watch the world go buy whilst drinking wine. Great atmosphere. Lots of eating places in this area

Sunday mass in rome. My daughter wished to celebrate mass and we could not have found a better place than this cathedral which was recommended by Marcus at the Hotel Morgana and it was close to the hotel too. Absolutly beautiful - un-missable.
Fabulous pace. One of the places that inspires and gets you astonished for its majesty and design. Convenient location from the Roma termini

Fabulous Church and great bars nearby!. This building has a great facade. Well worth a look. Best plan is to go in the evening, take a look, have an apertif, followed by dinner. All within a few mins walk in Trastevere.

Beautiful church and if your only going to see a couple make sure this is one of them!. Well worth a visit. If it looks closed please walk round to the other side as it isn't!! It's near the railway strait ion if your looking it up on a map and near St. Peter's in chains who's is also worth a visit.
wonderful church. wonderful church to visit. there is a little religious shop and a little museum. the 5th of august there is the miracolo della neve "snow miracle" you have to stay here.

Pure emotion. I am not catholic and cried.
