The miracle is celebrate each year on 5th aug when showers of white rose petals fall down on the congregation representing the snow.The 5C mosaics in the nave and on the chancel arch are amazing- they show scenes from the old and new testament.Everything about this basilica is stunning put it on your "to do list" making sure you don't miss out the underground museum here, its worth it.

Gorgeous church. We visited this church on Saturday afternoon, and there were many people actively using the church to pray, offer confession, hear a sermon - it was fantastic to see such a beautiful church being used in such a 'daily' way, rather than just being used as a museum. There were many, many beautiful artworks - in particular the mosaics of the Virgin Mary, created in 1295 - but what struck me most was how this church felt so loved. We saw many churches in Rome, but this, along with Sagre Cuore di Gesu on Via Marsala, was one of my favourites.
Awstruck!. There was no expense spared when building and decorating Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore. If you enjoy history and photography, this is a must-see.

Massive Basilica, Classical Architecture, Richly Decorated. Santa Maria Maggiore, one of the Vatican Basilicas, is located on the Esquiline Hill, north of the Forum/Colosseum and south of the train station. It is a massive structure of largely classical design. It contains superb mosaics and notable paintings. Next to St. Peter's, I believe Santa Maria Maggiore is the most impressive of churches in Rome.
One of the best. This church is amazing and big. Is located near hotel and you can also have mess there. We suggest to anyone to visit it!

Beautifull church outside main tourist routes. This church is one of the four Roman Basilicas (Toghether with San Pietro, San Paolo and San Giovanni). Very beautifully and reachly decorated. Fine mosaics.It is built on a hill, surrounded by large piazza, close to Termini. As it ls located outside of main tourists routes you will not find crowds of tourists here and can enjoy the interior in peace. If you continue all the way down via Merulana, you will arrive to another great Basilica, that is San Giovanni in Laterano, also highly recommended.

Where prayer meets splendour!!!. This is a patriarchal basilica dedicated to the Blessed Virgin Mary. Santa Maria Maggiore has the best mosaic across all churches in Rome.Very beautiful artwork & sculptures. like mostof Rome's churches, photography is not allowed here.
This place is amazing. Rome is one of the most beautiful cities in the world. Churches are amazing and the old romans ruins are true impressive.

Wonderful Surprise!. Walking back from the Colosseum, my friend and I came across this magnificent church. We were awestruck by how beautiful it was inside. Spend a couple of Euros to illuminate the various parts of the church; it really shows how beautiful the ceilings are. Highly recommend a visit.
Near Termini. Other church in the center of Rome, near Termini Station.Church very interesting, dedicated to Mary, mommy of Jesus...Beautiful church to visit .

Splendid Papal Basilica with highest bell tower in Rome. Splendid, fantastic, next only to St Peters. Outside at the rear is one of the twin Obelisks that were imported from Egypt centuries ago. This is directly on the city Tour hop on hop off bus route with the stop just at the side of the Basilica so would be a shame to miss it.
Very Beautiful Church. this church is very big and was our first in Rome, everything about it was awesome and made my must see list and was well worth it
Stunning cupolas from inside. free entry. Stunning ceilings and cuppola decoration. Needs about half an hour to see all. Definitely worth a visit
nice church. this was the first church we visited in Rome and were impressed. there was a nice nativity scene too. the church is huge and the entrance looks like its carved out of a rough rock.

Under estimated. You probably don't hear much about this church. Truth is, it's worth going. It's just beautiful, much as you would expect Rome to be. I highly recommend to visit this unconvienent place.

Gold on gold. This huge, impressive church is a strange mixture of styles, from medieval to baroque. What took my breath away at first was the triumphal arch, with Bible narrative mosaics and the golden dome behind. Then I saw the famous panels of C5 mosaics high along the nave, which are beautiful, although hard to make out in detail except at the end of my telephoto lens.

Gorgeous!. This Basilica was about a 5 minute walk from my hotel. I planned to just stop by for a few minutes to see it. Ended up spending more than an hour there and it was one of the highlights of my trip. The interior is overwhelmingly beautiful, second only to St. Peter's Basilica. I tried to take photos but everything is so ornate that it is impossible to capture! I found a 360 degree view online which I have been sharing with friends and family so that they can get a sense of the beauty and wonder of the place: http://www.vatican.va/various/basiliche/sm_maggiore/vr_tour/index-en.htmlDefinitely set aside at least an hour to see this, and if you have a chance check out the attached museum which can be accessed by passing through the gift shop. Tons of gold, papal robes, and other lovely items.

This was so beautiful,. Again a good camera is needed here. The ceilings, statutes and carving wow, just unbelievable. Again just try to walk around without the tourist group you will be able to see much more and most of all TAKE YOUR TIME.

Huge church/ basilica. Set in a large unexceptional square ,recommended you go inside to appreciate the size a decoration.The whole church is an amalgam of periods and additions. baroque and renaissance all in one . Not attractive but appreciate the grandeur

My favorite Basilica in Rome. This is one of the most beautiful churches in Rome. For an avid art lover and as a Christian this church embodies heavenly beauty on earth. Make sure and bring coins to put in the light box. To illuminate all the mosaics takes about 3 euros worth of coins. I'm continually amazed that tourist will spend thousands of dollars to make the trip to Rome, but will view the mosaics in darkness rather than donate a few euros. You can't really appreciate their detail or beauty unless they are lit.
Amazing. Good artwork and nice basilica. No extra charges and you can click a lot of good pics of the architecture.

Impressive day or night. I Usually visit during the day but this trip I had only an hour in early evening to visit. The subdued atmosphere impresses. It is one of the major churches in Rome and a visit confirms why.
Beautiful place dedicated to Our Lady. Gorgeous art work, impressive floors, not that very long queues to peek at the "Santo Leño" , a piece of wood that's meant to be a relic from Jesus Birthplace
truly beautiful. one of the first churches I visited and I made another visit on last day; the art work and statues are magnificant

Wonderful Church!!. Recommended by our hotel staff. Large, light on a nice little piazza very close to the train station. very pretty!! Stopped here as we were walking to the colosseum...definitely worth it
Worth a visit. Great church. I am not religious and found this church to be a bit different from the others. It felt quite friendly and happy. They do a great concet in December too
Must Sees in Roma. If you are a fan of church architecture and art, this is a must see. We spent over an hour here. It is one of the four papal basilicas of Roma and is just gorgeous.

The fist church in the world to celebrate midnight mass on Christmas. We attended midnight mass. The basilica was packed. The choir of men and women, the organ and a brass section made the experience transformational.

Beautiful church, beautiful piazza location too. Santa Maria Maggiore is a truly beautiful church. The art and sculptures around the church are inspirational to behold, and the church is less crowded then some others in Rome. There are also some great restaurants and cafes near by, so you can take a break after your visit to the church to let all the things you've seen really sink into memory.
beautiful Christmas service. Gorgeous church with beautiful paintings.. Visited for Christmas mass and enjoyed the experience very much

Go to the 10AM mass here!. The 10AM mass here is UNREAL! Gregorian novus ordo. If you are like me and like mass done right, you have to see this. You I'll get a procession of 10-20 bishops and cardinals, and music that will bring you to tears. A must do. There are Traditional Latin mass sights in Rome as well to see the great timeless mass, but this is stunning.

You have to visit!. The reason of to see it is the opportunity to see the first Virgin Mary Church. I would by no means suspend any pleasure to listen the audio guide (only 2 euros) to know the History of Amazing Church. I could feel a powerful feeling torwards me...

You must visit this church on your tour of Roma. Great place to visit and centrally located. It is one you should see of the many churches in Rome. Try to avoid the beggars but they are hard to avoid in this city. THey are everywhere.
great art to the glory of the christian god. Apart from St. Peter's there are a number of impressive basilica and cathedrals in Rome ,,,, this is one and not to be missed ....

my favorite of all in rome. this was my favorite basilica in all of rome. its quiet, cool, and hard squeaky chairs to sit on. i stopped in at least 10 times while in rome. and after youve been walking all day in the hot sun and loud crowds, finding a quiet cool place to relax is difficult in rome. the art inside is fantastic. the carvings in the floor are so unique and a change from the normal church.

Average for Rome. But much more than you can find in most other places on earth. If you have tim go there to see one of Rome's more important churches. If you don't have time there are better places to go.

Marvel. ANother of 5 papal basilicas of Rome, constructed on the early christian fundaments, inside maily Roman Gothic style, beautiful interior, not so crowded as St Peter, almost in the middle of the City, short walk from Colosseum, beautiful facade, easily accesible.

History in the center of town!. This enormous structure has many steps to navigate. But the architecture and historic value of it is beyond imagination. Parking is tough, so take a cab or bus to see it! Worth the visit!
very nice. its a church with large size and is excelent.one of the most beautiful in hole rome.recomendet for all ages
Marble heaven. If you are into marble this is te place for you. Beautiful Basilica, this was the first Basilica we visited, and set the bar high for the rest.

Columbus' gold fro America. Unique and different from other basiliques. Undergroud, there is a praying pop infront of Maria's child. The ceiling has squared patterns made of gold, which was the first gold from America after Columbus reached there! I could feel that I am the witness of the discovery of new world! Small separate praying places, where its decoration is also unique and original.
Was closed for maintenance when we visited. Was closed for maintenance when we visited so we wasted half a morning walking there an back. Cjeck before you visit.
Home for Relic of the Menger. A huge church not too far from Stazione Termini, that is not very frequented by tourists, but houses such an important relic, worth visiting.
beautiful Church, wonderful relics. This beautiful church houses a piece from the manger of Jesus Christ. we were lucky enough to be there for the Litany of Mary. Must see.

Rear is as beautiful as the Front. The rear has beautiful steps and statuary. We only saw the facade. Did not see anyway for disabled to enter, but we did not attempt. It was very near our hotel and the Train Terminal.
One of many beautiful basicicas. The building and decor are amazing. We were able to attend a mass and were welcomed by other parishoners.
magnificent maggiore. beautiful building which is well worth a view; steeped in history; peaceful and uplifiting; take time to soak up the view and ambience
Amazing building.. As you would expect amazing architect. Nice location and nice water features next to it. Take flat shoes and be prepared to walk though!

Santa Maria Maggiore. Beautiful building. Buses circle it since it's in the middle of Rome. All Basilicas are beautiful inside and out. We love every minute spent inside viewing the marble and paintings

You MUST visit this place. Entry is free, so make sure you check it out. One of the most amazing churches you'll ever see. Masses are taking place in the chapels while tourists check out the main hall. If you are lucky enough to see the priests undertaking a full mass, I suggest sticking around to see it. Such an amazing experience......and I have a healthy dislike for religion in general! For the catholics out there, you can even take confession while there.

Magnificent Mosaics. This is a huge church.There is plenty of impressive artwork and the whole church is a dazzling array of beauty. The mosaics are high up and next time I go I will take some binoculars (as recommended for the Sistine Chapel), but what you see is still worthwhile.

You must not miss this place. Here you really can see how the religion lives in perfect harmony with the society. At the same place tourists are wondering around, while in a side chapel a feew local people attending on a mass, at the same time a man goes to confession, while one of the main chapel is under instauration. I couldn't believe that these things work together and a church can function that much as a modern, common place for anybody.Around you at the same time you can find beautifull environment and on the top a little part of the holy cradle.

Very nice. had a great time here . Beautiful church with lots to see
Would come back again.. Very strange part of rome .

Santa Maria Maggiore. I have never seen a Church like this before, and this was probably the next best thing to St Peter's Basilica (bearing in mind it was shut on the day of our visit to the Vatican). The Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore is an extremely beautiful Church, while being very ornate. There is not a single corner that does not hold something fascinating for one to look at. You could spend ages in this Church - it has so many side Chapels and altars. We stayed for Mass which was something else also!

Get the $2 tour. Spectacular! I wanted to visit especially for Bernini's tomb. Ask in the gift shop about the 2 Euro tour, which includes the ancient outdoor mosaic and Bernini's winding staircase. This guided tour is the best value in town. Church services begin at 6:00 pm on Saturdays, at which time the altar area is blocked off.

Well Worth a Visit. This is really a beautiful church and worth a visit. The tomb of Bernini is here, as well as what are believed to be pieces of wood from Jesus' manger. We visited this church on a day we took the Hop On, Hop Off bus, so it saved us a lot of walking.

Interesting. Quite close to the Termini Station an impressive building. We had to walk almost all the way round to gain access but it was well worth it. Renovation work being done on the exterior Good to see things being looked after so well

Those mosaics!. Some of the most incredible Medieval mosaics in all of Rome! Go all the way to the back to see the mosaic of Jesus crowning his mother -- as any good son should ;0) . A beautiful place filled with light.
Beautiful. located just along from Hotel Termini. Easy to find. We visited this Basilica on our way to the Colosseum.
A hidden gem!. It would have been a shame to miss this Church. Beautiful Church with many artifacts. Not crowded and people respected that it was a church and were mostly silent. Very peaceful spot.

BURIAL PLACE OF BERNINI. Another fantastic roman church - dating from 432 A.C. - containing a second CAPPELLA SISTINA and the tomb of Bernini. This is one of the four BASILICA of Rome, it means that is a really important sacred place. Really rich decoration. Must see.
Magnificent. Very close to our hotel and near Termini. Lovely mosaics on the front though I would have liked a better view of them. A very large beautiful church.

what's with the lights?!. Wonderful church but why is it not possible to have the light swithes for the mosaics a little closer to the mosaics? At present you either do not realise there are lights at all, or by the time you have walked the length of the church after putting your money in the slot the time has run out!

but that window..... Gorgeous, historical church with a 1990's stained glass window over the entrance (donated....but nonetheless) that is totally out of place. Ignore that and you have a wonderful experience. Restroom facilities limited.

Santa Maria Maggiore. Check the time because we went late afternoon and it was closed. Glad we went back the next day because it was spectacular; full of riches, frescoes, statues and art. Magnicient ceiling paintings with gold. I could have spent at least an hour in this treasure. There were interesting shops nearby selling religious vestments and a monastic building. Well worth visiting if you are interested in religious history.
Beautiful. Passed this every day when staying at the Beehive hotel. It is beautiful and even though it is lesser known it is still one of the most enduring images I have of Rome

Lovely Church. This old roman church is near the Termini and is quite lovely. The floor mosiacs are intricate and the outside light shining on two of the side chapels add a special touch. It is smaller than many of the churches we have been in but one we enjoy visiting, Includes an archeological exhibit
Incredible!. Don't miss the chance to visit this beautiful basilica. In a city with one beautiful church after another, this stands out.

Breathtaking basilica. We had to visit this place as it is a UNESCO World Heritage site. The exterior is as beautiful as it is on the inside. The first thing we noticed when we stepped inside was the impressive ceiling that made the place really grand. There were many huge columns and we were really awed by the place. Do sit down on the benches and take in the sights. We also like that it was not crowded and quiet enough to enjoy the place.

Church. I could review EVERY church we saw during our visit to Rome and not tell you anything bad about any of them. In fact, you may re-read this review on another one! ALL the churches are breathtaking to see in Rome, but try, if you can, not to overdue it. We felt after #12 or so we were kind of like "Yup...another gorgeous church." You cant go wrong with any of them!
Religion. having visited churches in Malta I was a little disappointed at the interior and expected more from such a religious city

An unexpected find away from the city center!. After a long day of walking Rome, we found ourselves near this Cathedral. I saw it on the map and decided to walk a couple blocks to see it. It was dark at this point and we found the north side dark and locked. We walked to the South side and found it open and alive!Upon entering, you marvel at the immensity and beauty of the interior. It is a typical Cathedral in that it is tall, has stained glass windows, and worshippers, however there are plenty of statues and side rooms to keep you busy for awhile. It is free of charge and was a nice find. The Cathedral is in a square with its own fountain with lots of nightlife nearby including restaurants and shops.
Stunning. This is by far one of the most beautiful churches I have ever seen anywhere in the world! I highly recommend a visit to see the stunning architecture and adornments.
Nice. A great place to start your visit in Rome.Don't forget to have some scarf to cover your shoulders when you walk in !

A Lovely and important Basilica - fit it in whilst waiting for your bus tour from Termini.... For a group of children, this is a little easier to face than some of the larger religious places. The ceiling is well worth a study as is the tomb near the altar. We go regularly to Rome and book our open-air bus tickets the day before and visit this church on the way to the stop as you only need about 20 minutes.

A great church close to termini station. This was an impressive church close to our hotel.Since it is the first one we saw in our trip it left us with a great impression. This said, after a while, all churches (basilica) were becoming "the same": a lot of expensive ceilling and collumns. --Don't forget to remove your cap if you weare one! :)

Beautiful, serene and most worthy of a visit. I have truly loved visiting this basilica on both of my trips to Rome. Unlike the imposing cathedrals around Italy where you could spend hours walking around absorbing the architecture and art, this place of worship is a microcosm. The gold gilded ceilings are beautiful to behold. The basilica is a short walk from Termini station.

Great Experience. We stayed in the area for several days and didn't go inside until one day we strolled by and went in, WOW you could play football & basketball all at the same time. It is Big and Beautiful. 17 Pink marble columns each the size of a VW at the base support the roof. It's Great.
Ostentatious basilica. Out of all the basilicas we visited in Rome I liked this one the least. Very OTT decorations. But I guess it is on the 'must see' list of places to visit in Rome.
Beautiful church. The Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore is close to the Termini Station and the interior is fantastic (look at the ceiling first);

Another Beautiful Church. We visited Santa Marie on a Grayline tour (the tour was the worst we took in 2 moths in Europe). The Church is perhaps one of the most beautiful examples we saw and we saw more than I can remember to review! It is close to Termini station and near the tram lines so it is easy to get to on your own. I know ABC can be pejorative but it was truly memorable of the dozens of churches, cathedrals and basilicas we saw. Well worth the visit.
Beautiful. My second favorite church in Rome. Only second to St. Peter's. very beautiful and peaceful. Definitely worth a visit

Do not miss visiting the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore. This Basilica should not be missed! In addition to the beautiful artwork, marble carvings, etc. the Basilica houses a glass crypt which is holding authentic pieces of the cradle that held Baby Jesus in Bethlehem. We were awestruck and visited twice, we were so moved.

Basillica of St. Mary Major. This is a very beautiful and sacred place. When one walks in, it has the feeling of stepping into another realm.It is simple, yet elegant in the decor. Many beautiful and majestic statues and paintings adorn the Basilica, surrounded by the glow of candles and soft light. In fact, it can be rather dark inside, making photography somewhat of a challenge. The altar is ornate and beautiful, especially for visitors from the States where our Churches more often than not, resemble gymnasiums. Something else to consider is the other-worldy heat if one visits in the summer time. There is no air-conditioning, nor did we see any fans. We went to Mass on a Sunday afternoon in September, and I almost passed out from the heat. But aside from that, it is well worth a visit.
Must visit. This is where the Crib of Jesus is encased in glass, pieces of the Crib though. Its is found in one of the altars inside the Church.

Masterpiece Roman church. There are endless wonders and delights inside this place, so give it the time it merits to discover it. Also, take the tour! They will show you around the archaeological dig downstairs, the hidden loge, and the masterful Scala di Bernini, a one-piece spiral staircase designed by the master sculptor himself.
Important Church. One the four main Church in Rome, close to Termini station. I have felt the right Christian Atmosphere inside. To be included in Rome visit

Our hotel was right across the street. We could look at this wonder all day and night. it is very magical at night all lit up. the interior is fabulous. the mosaics are beautiful. it is amazing that it is so old, and in such a wonderful condition. if you can, attend a mass. It was beautiful
Beautiful Church. Beautiful interior and has a definite wow factor. Was fairly busy when we visited in November, would be a bit mad in summer I think. Well worth a visit.
Beautiful!. Words don't do this justice. Go and see for yourself. It's awe inspiring. Well worth a visit. You won't be disappointed.

A great place for people like history, art and religion. Great place. So many religious art in this place. Look also the floor. Take time to seat and feel the atmosphere of the place. Many paintings that I knew in my scolar time were there. A great place to go around at exterior.
Incredible atmosphere. This is a beautiful church - visit on a Sunday and you'll be lucky enough to catch a service. Well worth a visit for the amazing atmosphere

Worth seeing. this marvel . This is more of a working church than many of the other majors. when I've visited there have always been at least a couple of masses in the chapels. The museum is poor but the building is very impressive.

Impressive. We happened to hit this location when a choir and brass band from Germany were there participating in a service. It was really wonderful . The church itself is beautiful and the accoustics memorable.
When there is a mass. please remain silent and at least walk around quietly and discreetly! If you don't respect the religion then don't go in. A really beautiful church.

We visited while Mass was being celebrated. It seemed odd that tourists were allowed to walk around, taking photos and talking while Mass was being celebrated and I preferred to stand at the back of the Basilica and watch. It is well worth visiting for its architecture and art work and also the small museum to the side of the building.
Wonderful 5th century church. Mosaics with clear colours show Mary being crowned - some of the oldest and most beautiful mosaics in the world in this working church. Close to Termini Station.

The most beautiful church of our trip & the service was a wonderful experience. The church is the most beautiful we saw on our trip and we stayed for 2 services because the singing of the monks was heavenly, the atmosphere so awe-inspiring, and the congregation so interesting to watch.

The best church in Rome. The amazing size and architecture of this church is incredible. The gold was impressive and we were told it was gold brought back from Mexico and South America by the explorers.

Beautiful Church!. We really loveed the Church. It wasn't far from where we stayed and I wasn't really expecting anything much from it, but in the end it was one of the most beautiful Churches that we'd seen!

St. Mary Major. We visited The Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore in the afternoon of a full day tour of the Vatican and Major churces outside of the Vatican. While there is nothing comparable to the Vatican and the Sistine Chapel, it is croweded and you cannot take pictures. The churces outside of the Vatican are magnificient and majestic with their gold ceilings and life like statues. While there, you can take pictures while touring or pray. Our guide, who was originally from Massachusetts said that is was her neighborhood church when she was single. If this was my neighborhood church, I would surely attend weekly mass.
A Little visited Gem. Located between Termini and the Colosseum this is one of the most beautiful interiors of the cathedrals in Rome which is belied by iys more modern exterior later cladding

Beautiful Basilica. This church was one of the beatuiful attractions to Rome. Less busy but equally as majestic.
The history surrounding it is also very fascinating. It was absolutely beautiful. We were only a few blocks from there so we visited a couple of times. It is MUST SEE.

There's Gold Here. The Basilica of St. Mary Major (Santa Marian Maggiore) is only a few blocks from Rome's Termini Train Station. The ceiling contains the first gold sent back to the pope from the "New World" (North America). It's an expansive building, the majorityof which dates back to ancient Rome. It has a beautiful mosaicabove the central altar, other significant art, and the relics of thecrib of Bethlehem, which are displayed in the "confessio" belowthe high altar. It's a very worthwhile stop with many photo opportunites.
Santa Maria Maggiore- Saint Maria of the nativity. Brilliant- they had a gregorian choir singing in the background. People everywhere. Delightfully decorated church rich with history.
Nice church. Not far from the railway station, nice peaceful church with great fresco's. The piazza is also nice to wander around.
WOW Again. It is apparent that any site you visit in Rome makes you feel you have taken part in a historical phenomenem but this place is so beatifull. The facade, the entrance, everything is so WOW.

My childhood Church!. I grew up going to church here every Sunday or holy day of obligation! We confessed our "venial" sins by kneeling before a confessional and a priest would lower the iron rod he held and tap us on the head for absolution! The church steps unfortunately on the back side are no longer open to public, but still a sight to see. Go inside and experience more spiritual splendor and note how it is always filled with visitors from all over the world, and rightfully so!
ABSOLUTELY STUNNING. There are not enough superlatives to describe this church. It is STUNNING both inside and out. Whatever you do, make an hour to go around and inside it

Very pretty church. One of my favorites. The church is huge.. I went during mass so touring the church was limited but I have to say that the size and the artistic details (especially the ceiling) impressed me immensely. It's one of the top basilicas in Rome. St. Peter's in chains is nearby but not nearly as nice.

Beautiful Basilica. Beautiful facade outside and once you're inside the beauty continues. There's a nice stained glass window of Mary that illuminates the main hall. There are intricate frescoes and artifacts all over the Basilica. Here there is an artifact that holds remains of the cradle of Jesus.

A Beautiful Basilica and Bernini's Grave. The exterior and part of the interior of Santa Maria Maggiore was under construction when we visited. The church was extremely beautiful inside. It is the largest church in Rome dedicated to the Virgin Mary. Go down the steps to see the grave of Gian Lorenzo Bernini, who designed so many of the fountains in Rome, was one of the Architects of St. Peter's and who designed the great alter canopy in St. Peter's Basilica.

Masterpiece. It was the first basilica I had visited in Rome 20 years ago, because it was near our hotel in Termini then. I've been for 3 times in Rome since there, but I visit Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore every time. It's masterpiece. Nothing else to say.
Stunning. Popped in here just because it was on our way to the Coloseum! So glad we did. It is beautiful and Mass was on in a side area. It felt like a real place of worship .
Beautiful. This is an amazing church. We almost didn't go inside, but were so glad we did. It is free and well worth a short visit!

Beautiful. One not to miss!!! From the outside although a very impressive building you would not expect the beauty and wonderful sights within, Once you step inside you it literally takes your breath away with its outstanding beauty. It has an amazing peaceful Aura about it and envelopes you as you enter through the doorway. Just sit in one of the seats and take in the beauty. Amazing.

Beautifull. A stunning basillica from the outside full of art and architechtural features you'd expect from a top roman church, yet when you walk inside it takes your breath away with its outstanding beauty. The ceilings and floors in the main part are a sight to behold yet pale into insignificance when you visit the side chapels which are as beautifully decorated as anything in this world
Great. Great arts great area.Really fantastic would deffinately visit again. If I went to Rome which is going to be unlikely. I didn't throw my coins in the fountain

The Second Best Bascilica We Visited. We stayed right by Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore so we had to stop in. Boy, we we surprised. Its not that impressive from the outside, but the interior is very impressive and beautiful. I thought is was second only to St. Peter's Basiilica. It is definitely worth a stop if you are nearby. Entrance is free but there is a small fee for an attached museum which we did not do.

The most beautiful church. It is huge yet there are small corners. Very ornate. Supposed to house a relic from the nativity crib. Some former popes buried there. Toilets the best in any public place we were in in Rome. Saw some ladies struggling to light the automatic candles - maybe they measured the contribution before lighting up!

Be aware the "other" Sistine chapel is closed.. I was following a recent guide book but many of the special features have been moved to different places, and there is renovation going on which will take several years. It is still magnificent but I wanted to see the other Sistine Cahpel and could not.

worth a visit. This basilica holds the relic of the crib of Jesus Christ and lots of other relics and wonderful artwork. Many famous Catholics are buried here; Popes, Cardinals and also the artist Gian Lorenzo Bernini. The basilica was in walking distance of our hotel (Hotel Paba on Via Cavour). The romans fill their drinking bottles in the fountain across the street of the Basilica; But lots of pigeons take a bath in this fountain, so we chose not to drink from this fountain ;-)

Beautiful structure. Peaceful and spiritual,Magnificient architecture. It is quoted in one of the books that the Virgin Mary appeared to one of the popes and on that place the Basilica was constructed. It can be enjoyed sitting on one of the seats around the Basilca.

Czech (Slavonic) trace. Imposant church.
A place where the pope Adrian II approved a liturgy to be served in slavonic language in Great Moravia in 9th century AD by Konstantin and Method (Cyril and Metodej).
Also a tomb of Maxmilian of Pernstejn at the entrance at the beginning of the right nave.
Worth seeing.
A MUST SEE. There are hundreds of churches in Rome wit the Vatican being of course the one we all want to see BUT don't miss this one.

Go for the Statue of Mary Seated in Judgment. My purpose in going to this Cathedral was to see the white marble statue of Mary seated on a throne, with her right hand raised in judgment. It is a very uncommon depiction of her and I found it to be very moving and powerful. (I've attached a photo.) For me, it was worth a trip to this cathedral just to see that statue. Apart from that, this is an enormous, cavernous cathedral, filled with tour groups, and to me, less interesting or moving than many others such as Santa Maria dei Angeli or the Pantheon.

Beautiful Basilica. Within easy walking distance from Roma Termini is this wonderful Basilica. It has an interesting history with some parts datings back to 432AD. The museum which costs 3 euros is well worthwhile, incorporating some of the heavily embroidered robes worn by the cardinals and popes as well as statues, gold chalices etc. Shoulders and knees must be covered but they do supply a disposable "cloth" if you are not prepared.
beautiful. There are so many beautiful churches in Rome but this interior is one not to be missed. The ethereal blue ceiling and fabulous art work is a must see.

Beautiful church. Didn't intend to visit this place, just happened to be walking past it and decided to go in. It is a beautiful church. We were lucky enough to witness a service (at about 5:30pm), which was very moving. I am so glad we visited here.

Beautiful Church. Even if you're not particularly religious it's worth going in and looks so beautiful inside. Photos are allowed in most areas and women must cover shoulders and knees (they can give you a cloth to put around if not).
Beautiful Church. If you are near the square...stop in and experience this beautiful church dedicated to the Virgin Mary. One of the nicest in rome!

Definitely worth a visit. Like all churches in Rome entrance is free. This one has an enormous sculptor of a kneeling pope and some wonderful marble.I don't like to say too much in case it spoils your visitTake small coins for light machines.
Beautiful Church. This church was beautiful. Breathtaking to go inside and see it. Built many years ago and so interesting to see these old churches.
worth a visit. We had our rosary blessed here by a VERY kind English speaking priest. It's not St. Peter's BUT it's worth a visit.

Santa Maria Maggiore and surrounding area. We never tire to visit Rome and we always make it a point to attend Mass at Santa Maria Maggiore. There is something in this Basilica which is very difficult to pinpoint which attracts me like a magnet. It may be the serenity or the majestic splendour of this huge place of worship and work of art that moves my steps towards it and that makes me book a Hotel in the area.We went for five days to Rome in August this summer and stayed in this area . Via Cavour is alive morning and night during siesta time it is slow but at all other times it is lively. It is a pleasant promenade every so often we stop for a cappuccino or a cold bottle of water . There are also all kinds of restaurants Asian,Italian, French and Indian. A favourite of my husband is a restaurant/ pub called Marconi and situated in Via Prasede ,one of the side streets, close to the Basilica. Here my husband's favourite dish is sausages and sauerkraut. The square as most other squares in Rome seems to be the meeting place of everything from adolescents , Hop on Hop off buses , Taxis ,old people ,beggars, actually quite a lot of them, and tourists.I really do not know exactly what people look for when on holiday but as far as I am concerned I like to relax watch the hassle and bustle of the people,the life of the place Personally I get a kick out of observing the little old ladies who still care about their appearance and yet manage to look their age. Once we went during the winter season and I marvelled at their fur clothes. They looked warm and elegant and I said in my heart of hearts "Oh poor animals "what people do in order to look chic always surprises me oh well one of those things very few people dare correct ! they are old people after all and environmentalists were not a la mode when they bought those fury coats and jackets so they are excused. Nevertheless observing the people strolling in their streets to go most probably to some place is a simple cheap occupation to be taken up by the holiday maker if it strikes one's fancy. Piazza Maggiore is a typical Italian square and provides entertainment that does not cost any money.This is a part of Rome which I make it a point to visit and never tire of it. Buon viaggio!
You may not have heard of it. This is not as well known as many other places in Rome, but it is well worth a visit. It has grand art and a real feel of spirituality.
Must stop!!!. Don't miss the golden ceiling. You will be glad you did. This is one of the four major churches you must visit.

A tour of the past. We were able to tour Santa Maria Maggiore with a local guide and resident expert. We were able to go into the underground under the church to see all of the homes that used to be there that were found during digs a while back. We also saw the 2nd story of the church where there are Papal robes worn over the centuries. The Church itself is breathtaking and the artwork renders you speechless.
Beautiful. One of the largest and apparently richest church in Rome. Beautiful interior, allows photos. Pity about the gift shop!Located near the Termini station.
Basilica Santa Maggiorre. Beautiful basilica, well kept, with its own museum below. ( however all exhibits are shown in Italian) Local wedding taking place in one of the chapels when we visited.

Great Church close to the Termini. This church was really delightful. Plus, it's really convenient to visit considering that it's close to Termini station. There are also several other sites worth seeing which are close. The Baths of Diocletian, Roman National Museum, and Hop On and Hop Off buses are located nearby. There are so many churches to see in Rome, that it seems overwhelming at times. This was a delightful church with many other worthwhile sites in the area. Considering how beautiful it was, and it's close proximity to other sites.... I would not miss this church.

Fitting resting place of Bernini. Prior reviewers have explained much that is wonderfu about this large church, but I did not notice any that had mentioned that you can tour the balcony and rooms above for a small fee in addition to the museum fee in the basement of the church. For this you will get a personal tour of wonderful statues and mosaics on the balcony and artifacts in the rooms that were once used as the personal residence of a Pope,
Beautiful!. Beautiful church, there was a cardinal mass on whilst we were there and we were blessed by a cardinal!

Don't miss this one.. Wow,just divine,don't miss out on this one,you will not be disappointed.Its architecture is just brilliant.wall paintins and monument to Bernini were amazing..The shrine to the Holy Manger is also worhy of a mention.

Beautiful church. Probably the most beautiful church in Rom. Beautiful marble.From the 400 th century.
Close to the railway station.

Beautiful, meaningful .... Again one of the four major basilicas in Rome. Aside from its grandiose beauty, to the Christian pilgrim, seeing part of the crib where Jesus was born is just a moving and touching moment.

Beautiful building inside and out. The architecture of this building is something for the eye to behold, it is wonderfully located on elevated position looking impressively onto rome. The detail and structure of the building makes it hard not to appreciate in all its glory. And the meaning of the building is conveyed in the wonderful art work and imposing architecture of the Basilica

Amazing interior. We approached the Basilica from what turned out to be the rear, not really knowing what it looked like, and thinking it was closed! However we walked round to the front and went inside. There were no queues and although plenty of people were inside it didn't seem crowded. The whole place is covered with things to see and there is a huge sculpure of a pope that was amazing. If you like churches then this is a must see.
awesome. solemn and severe, notwithstanding the gold mosaics. rather big. was built after snow miraculously fell on rome in the II century AD.

It is one of the best. It is mandatory to visit. It is beautiful and for catholic people it is meaningful. I was told that it was the Lady herself that inspire the construction of the church. She appear in a dream of the Pope and a man named Giovanni ( that sponsored the construction) announcing that the appropriet place to built the church would be indicated miraculously. Then on the morning of August 5, (in the meddle of the Summer) an abnormal snow fell on a hill. That is the place where the church was built. Nowadays in memory of Our Lady of the Snow, there is a celebration of the miracle of the snowfall on August 5 each year.

1st Day in Rome - wondering around. Stumbled on this amazing Basilica. It was magnificent and so historical! My 12 year old couldn't get over the size of the organ pipes! The art and architecture, as well as the historical courtyard was almost magical.
Beautiful Basilica. A beautiful basilica offering a great place of beautiful scenes and great architecture. A great spot for any traveller :)

What a historic church.. It was Sunday, and a mass was onging, it was helped by the Organ, what a heavenly music, the church, the cieling, the religious statues, it was impresive and serene.
a must see, even for non-believers.
Beautiful. This was one of the 6 churches that we visited on our Christian Tour. It is beautiful and the Reliquary of the Holy Crib is so meaningful. Pieces of the Holy Manger...wow...

pope in every corner. once visited never forgotten, our friends took us there and were able to point out that every pope has a portrate on the wall somewhere.beautifully decorated as all Roman basillicas are well worth a visit.
Beautiful Basilica. This is a beautiful Basilica and is only a few blocks from the Termini Station. You can find good deals shopping since the area is not that great.
Magnificent. I visited the basilica without expecting much but I was blown away once I got inside. Just stunning! I actually like Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore more than St. Peter's Basilica.
Great visit. Liked it all, it was free, the paintings were excellent, frescos great and floor impressive. A very calm interior with no manic queueing as per other Rome places.
Everyday view. Beautiful church with great architecture. Every corner of the church has something beautiful to look at. It's just so beautiful! Incredible. great place for vist
Lovely. This Basilica was close to my first hotel. I went to mass here on a Sunday morning. It was beautiful and deserted so I can't say how busy it would be during the day. Very peaceful.
Beautiful. What a wonderful, poetic, awe inspiring spectacle, just looking up and around the amazing architecture on this wonderful building - absolutely takes your breath away.
The main Maria church in Rome. One of the finest churches in Rome (in my views). Take a good look at the statue in the crypt. The finest artwork on a marble statute of a pope. Top.
A Masterpiece. With so many incredidble churches, you would think there is overload; not so. This place is spectacular.
worth the time. Be prepared to be wowed especially if this is your first church in Rome as it was ours. Gives you an idea of the scale of the power of the church in the renaissance.
Worth the trip to see this church. This church was near our hotel and we would never have visited it had it not been so close. It was one of the most beautiful we were in on our Rome visit.

Santa Maria Maggiore. I am not the biggest of believers but I was inspired by this gem, really good "Free" attraction. I would recommend a visit to this excellent building. A great value outlet for religious artifacts and gifts.
Doesn't look much from outside. But be prepared to be pleasantly surprised within. Well worth a wander round. Another great church to while away the time in - are there any bad ones in Rome?
Stunning. Where to look in such an amazing place. The frescos the awe inspiring edifices and bernini's work are brilliant. It called afew times during our stay in rome
Wow! Your eyes won't know where to look!. Beautiful church with great architecture. Every corner of the church has something beautiful to look at. It's just so beautiful!

Breath taking. this was our first stop since it was just around teh corner from our hotel...took my breath away. It is required for women to cover themselves and they do offer scarfs to cover your shoulders when entering..
Doesn't compare to St Peters. Although its major basilica, it really doesn't compare to St Peter's basilica. It is a nice place to go and pray.

Beautiful church within a couple blocks of our hotel.. Went to Mass here after arriving in Rome and checking in to our hotel on a Sunday morning. The church was beautiful inside and much cooler than the outside heat!

Exquisite. This is tucked away, so you must be persistent in finding it, but its beauty is well worth it. I do wish the piazza had been more animated. It was dilapidated when we were there. Pictures are allowed, and you will want to take them.
Impressive marble. Take your time and soak up the art work, the beautiful marble floors and gilded ceiling. Don't forget the crypt up by the altar. Just a feast for the eye to behold.
Unbelievable.. Who knew this church would have such an ornate ceiling when viewed from the piazza at the back? Absolutely amazing and aweinspiring.

killaloe group. the frescos in this basilica are lovely was at mass here a few times be careful of pickpockets in this area the shops in this area are fairly reasonable one big shop like dunnes stores there is a legend that snow fell here in august be careful of the steps as you go in

Huge church. I love that in Rome, you can go inside these big churches without having to pay. In Venice you pay to get into everything. The art inside and architecture were amazing. Well worth it to take the time to go in.

Very pretty church.. As are all the churches we visited, this one was beautiful. The ceilings as well as the floors are gorgeous. The relic of wood from the manger of Christ was on display in this church.

A beautiful basilica. This is a very large basilica in central Rome and one of the oldest. It's quite beautiful but also has less that feels personal than many of the other churches. The mosaics are beautiful. Normally I suggest experiencing many churches during mass, when you can really contemplate all the splendors, but here I was overwhelmed with the extreme use of incense. Wait till its over. It's also a little easy to get disoriented when leaving. Watch for pickpockets outside.

face the holliness. in my last day in Rome,i woke up and intended to traipse all the historic sights .in european cities you have to walk and explore city by foot by touch the sand with your foot.in the route i choose i started from Piazza Navona and ended to Santa Maria Maggiore near to my residential in Radisson,the white and gigantic architecture was dominating,in one word every thing in rome is worth to to see thousand times
Stunning. Exceptional inside. Beautiful artwork. There was so much to look at. We sat down for about 30 mins just looking at everything and walked around for another hour admiring the place.

Beautiful. We came here by chance as we had a few hour layover before our trip departed the nearby Termini. We simply started walking and stumbled upon this beautiful basilica. It was beautiful and ornate, as well as a great place to get out of the summer heat. They do have a great assortment of relics and antique items that hold special meanings for those of the Catholic persuasion.

A beautiful basilica! Visit if you are in Rome!. Really enjoyed the visit to the Basilica :) The architecture and works of art are beautiful :) Would advise a guide or a guide book not to miss out on the wonders of this Church :)

Impressive and close to a lot of the hotels.. Literally found this by accident, round the corner from our hotel which was close to Republica and the Opera House. Impressive interior. seems that this is one of the churches that has been better preserved??Probably the closest impressive site to the main Termini train station/coach drop off point. I'm not religious really but the decor inside was impressive. Close by is decent pizza at Est Est Est.
Major Basilica!. Big and beautiful Basilica with impressive paintings and ornaments. Consider your dress code, the people at the entrance can be very strict!

Beautiful church with a small museum below it.. As all churches in Rome, this is a very beautiful one. What can I say, architecture, art, you name it. Even more interesting is the museum below. There you can see a lot of relics, papal robes, etc. Very interesting indeed!

One of the world's most magnificent churches. The magnificence of the mosiacs, the Icon to the madonna, the wonderful ceiling, the order and regularity of the rites, the music at High Mass and the friendliness of the personnel

Santa Maria Maggiore. this Basilica is right al your finger tips if you arive by train , station TERMINI is just a few blocks away , the ceiling is incredible , almost 3d , i attended a mass there once given by one of Romo's Cardinals . the first thime i saw it the outside was filthy but i have return since then and now the exterior is in much better shape , still beautiful though and worth a visit and it is free

One of the world's great buildings!. Everything about this church is superlative! The ancient mosiacs, the cosmati floor, the gilded ceiling and the sheer size and history of the place. If you get the chance go on the 5th of August, the aniversary of it's foundation as there are events all day ending with an amazing sound and light show outside in the evening.

Lovely church. Great history of the catholic church - be sure to go out behind the gift shop and see the museum down the stairs. That was really interesting and included a wonderful collection of personal items belonging to many of the Popes

Beautiful church but you get the bums rush.... Went to Mass here on Saturday evening. The service was fine, but they basically rush you out afterwards. We had about 5 minutes to appreciate the beauty of the building before ushers were asking us to leave. As we took photos they were following us right out to the gate and then locked it. Too bad
A blessed visit. We were awed by the majesty of this great church. We arrived to visit just when a service was started to honor the Virgin Mother. What a joyous service and a blessing to have shared
Beautiful Church. Well worth a visit to both the church and underground museum. The church is full of colorful mosaics which were stunning!!

It looked closed but... We were walking down the street looking for it and when we got to it we thought it was closed. On the way back I asked someone and they told me that was the back of the church! I wanted to see this because of the mosaics, but they didn't seem spectacular to me.

It looked closed but... We were walking down the street looking for it and when we got to it we thought it was closed. On the way back I asked someone and they told me that was the back of the church! I wanted to see this because of the mosaics, but they didn't seem spectacular to me.

Beautiful. We stopped by this magnifient Basilica while walking around Rome. I am so glad we did! It really is another of the must see attractions in Rome and certainly one of the most amazing churches in Rome. There were no crowds and entry was easy. Make it part of your walking tour of Rome.
Absolutely beautiful. We were lucky to stay just below this stunning Basilica. Well worth a visit - the inside is breathtakingly beautiful.
I adored this church!. A beautiful church that I went back to a number of times, constant masses as well, if you are a Catholic like me and wish to attend.
Huge church. Large church, amazing bells. Easy to find. One of the best we have seen in Rome. Lots of activity around it as well.
love the atmoshepere. love the huge basilica near termini. Inside was stunning and breathtaking, the scultures and the ceiling.. best basilica in the centro storico-
It's a church, right? But much more.. Architecture worth studying, magnificient history, not as crowded as some other tourist stops, easy access, a must see.

Renaissance beauty. I visited this magnificent basilica on the day when they celebrated their Feast of Dedication, one of the great feast days of Rome. The liturgy was magnificent and beautiful and, as a visitor, I felt swept up by the wonder of the worship. Of particular note was the .Miracle of Rome' when millions of white petals fell from the ceiling into the crypt during the Gloria - no wonder the congregation applauded at this moving tradition.

Stunning. If you visit no other church in Rome - visit this one. Bernini's massive funerial sculptures are breathtaking. On the far-right of the alter, near an inconspicuous marble step, is his tomb marker. The sacristy and ceiling were most impressive. And best: no crowds (like in St. Peter's).

Breathtaking!!. We stayed at a hotel (Hotel Raffaello) just around the corner from this Basilica. I attended an early morning mass here one day, and was in awe and grateful for the experience! This church is stunning and rich in culture/history and art and is a must to see...no words can describe its heavenly beauty!!

Amazing!. Everyone has always said Rome has the most beautiful Basilicas, but you can never truly understand what they mean until you witness them for yourself. I never though a church could be as beautiful as the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore... but I was in awe when I saw all of the beautiful colors, paintings and stained glass. You will miss it the second you leave Rome.
See it!. This is but one of many churches, cathedrals, and basilicas in Rome. It us much more than a tourist stop, it is an active worshipping house of worship.

The craddle of Jesus. The splendid Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore, is the most ancient Christian basilica in the West dedicated to the mother of Jesus. In the night of August between the 4th and 5th of the year 358, the Virgin Mary appeared in a dream to senator Giovanni Patricio and Pope Liberious, asking that a basilica be dedicated to her on the site where that night, it would snow. The next morning Patricio and the Pope went to the place where that night a heavy snow had fallen. There the Pope traced the outline of the future church in the fresh snow. It is also said that the reliquary beneath the altar contains a piece of wood of Jesus' cradle

It is wonderful place!!!!!!!. This church is wonderful place. Close to Termini Station. Very rich archtecture, Various tombs inside there. Every papal basilicas are very rich. There are some beautiful paints.
Mindblowing!. The exterior does not prepare you for the experience of the inside of this beautiful church. You must visit this impressive basilica and marvel at the sights.

Impressive..... Imposing, building sitting in the middle of a traditional piazza.Very impressive interior - ticks all the boxes as far as what you'd expect from a Roman church.We fell upon the musuem underneath by accident which i think cost 3euros - but was air conditioned....worth the money alone on a very hot day.Well worth a visit.
Closed but open. Listed as a site where you could access WC but they close them an hour or so before they close the building ughhh

Very Nice Church. This is a massive church, we stayed just around the corner from the church and passed it everyday and everyday we noticed something new about it. Inside there is some amazing Fresco work and a multitude of side chapels with amazing mozaic work.
BEAUTIFUL. Such a beautiful place!!!!! go see the 4th Holy door amazing, the only church to still be the original, never has been remodel or redone since it was constructed.
Not to be missed. The church is beautifully decorated. By chance I realised that there is a museum to the right. Stunning vestments from previous popes. A very moving experience. Not to be missed!

Santa Maria Maggiore. This Basilica was close to my hotel and I visited it the last night I was in Rome. It's an impressive building with some really pretty stained glass and an amazing statue of a kneeling bishop or pope in a vestibule below. There are beautiful muraled domes and statuary to admire. But what intrigued me most was a piece of stained glass which had a pyramid with an eye in the middle. Clearly this was designed with some Masonic influence. If you love art and pretty churches, this is one of the better ones I saw in Rome.
Different than the rest. This church stands out among the other Roman churches. It has a flat gold ceiling and other unique architecture. Definitely worth a visit.
Breath taking church!. There are no words to describe this church. It's overwhelming beauty makes you a believer. Even the ceiling awe inspiring!
Beautiful. Stunning both inside and out, we found it a lot quieter than a lot of the attractions we visited, and there's a great gelateria opposite!
Basilica di Santa Maggiore. it is one of the Basilica to visit in Roma. I did not want to miss it because I personnaly like icons and there is a very ancient icon of The Lady Theotokos.

A must see. An unusual church. The astonishingly large interior is more like an antique Roman temple. The decoration - wooden ceiling ornamented with gold brought by Columbus from the New World, the fifth century mosaics... beautiful!

Magnificent. Well we actually didn't have the time to go inside. But when we arrived to Rome, we got off at Termoini station and while heading to our hotel it was the first "rome thing" we saw. And the church is absoloutely breathtaking on the outside.
Well worth a visit. An amazingly beautiful church and one of the richest in terms of relics. Well worth a visit. Can be seen from the open top tour bus and you can get off at a stop near to it.

beautiful basilica. We went to hear mass at this enormous basilica. Sunday mass is held at 10.00am and it was cantata in latin. The basilica itself is majestic with big statues of saints. Even seen from the back it looks a majestic building.

Nothing quite like it. Everyone will remember certain places for sometimes seemingly arbitrary reasons. Before I came here, I already knew a lot about this site. Before the shrines in Lourdes, Fatima, or Mexico City, this was one of the most popular and important Marian churches in the world. At Christmas and Easter, the stations for the day were not at St. Peter's, not at St. John Lateran, but at the ancient "Liberian Basilica." The facade is unique with the arches on the bottom and top. At night, the view is stunning as you can see the light hitting the mosaics that are behind the top layer of arches. The interior, although imposing, has a very elegant simplicity. It doesn't feel cold like St. Paul's Outside the Walls or as overwhelming as St. Peter's. It goes without saying to see the old mosaics on the apse. The chapels are sublime, but at the time, I unfortunately could not make it to the other Sistine Chapel. I did make it to an early morning mass at the Borghese chapel though, and there was nothing quite like it that I found anywhere else in Rome.
Sunday Mass. So happy that we didn't miss Mass. We arrived on Sunday and spent the day walking around and found this beautiful Church.

Amazing Basilica. This stunning historical church has been overlooked by many other Basilicas in Rome. It is so gorgeous and you must go down into the pit to see the kneeling statue. Really beautiful.

Just felt the history and the holiness.. This Basilica is just so huge. So much gold!! "Not sure if they should be proud of taking the gold from the Americas though.This is a must see. There are listening posts and you can tune in on wifi. Mass was being said in some of the chapels. confession on all the time. Prayerful atmosphere.
Beautiful. Most beautiful church I have ever visited. near the Trevi Fountain in Republica nearest metro stop - had a job crossing the road!!

Worth a visit. Santa Maria Maggiore is one of the four major basilicas in Rome. It is easy to get to from the Metro and it was much less crowded than St. Peter's so it had a more reverent atmosphere. One disappointing note: the Sacra Culla (sacred crib) had been removed for restoration and was unavailale for viewiing. There is a mseum/crypt downstairs. (You have to go out a side entrance to enter the crypt) It does charge a small fee, but is bright and has some nice pieces.

Stunning!. Words cannot do this site justice. Jaw dropping beauty! You just have to see it to appreciate it. You will take photographs to show your family and friends, but the images will always always stay in your memory.
Massive church but actually empty inside. It is big church from outside but inside is quite empty. It did not have amazing interior like other churches in Rome.
What a surprise. Didn't expect this to be quite so lovely inside. But it is very impressive
Beautiful. Superb interior with such a calming atmosphere. Well worth a visit to see this fantastic church.
Great Church. One of the four major basilicas in Rome. Easy to get to and great to see. Went to mass while we were there.
visit but watch your wallet. very interesting but crowded. some beautiful features

Large ornate church. Santa Maria Maggiore has a lot to see inside and is also a good place to hang out at in the evening. Located on its own little island in the middle of the traffic there is always something to watch.
Great. Across the street from the train station. From the outside it looks like the ruins of the roman bathes it was created from. Once you enter it is truly awe inspiring.
Worth visting!. If you have the time, worth going to see! There are so many works of art to see, it can be overwhelming. But this should be on your list.
As impressive inside as out. It might be well decorated and gilted inside, but there's never the feeling of bling or excess. It's a relaxing place that is well worth visiting
Imaculate! Wow!. Our host informed us that the first gold that Christopher Columbus brought back from the New World is inlayed into the ceiling of this church - We were't suprised. It's amazing!

Excellent, monumental church. Santa Maria Maggiore made a really great impression with all the side chappels and great pieces of art. It is actually a small version of the St. Peter's cathedral. Definitely worth a visit.
I liked it. One of the four Vatican churches, it is one of the most impressive in the city.
A must for visitors. This is one of the more interesting churches in Rome; I have visited on numerous occasions and never tire of seeing it, cover shoulders and knees when entering.

Beautiful church. Beautiful church is richly decorated and is one of the largest Roman basilica. dating from the 5th century. I was thrilled with the beautiful mosaics and a mixture of various styles.
beautiful. walking distance from the hotel colosseum. also visible from the hotel roof top terrace
A nice place to see.. A place to visit but are other most important places to see when in Rome.
Awesome. What a beautiful cathedral. Take a hop on hop off bus and be sure and stop here.
Astoundingly beautiful!. Not only is the outside something to marvel at, but the interior is just breathtaking. The frescos, the stain glass windows, everything! It's a definite site not to miss.

Just Another Basilica?. You might say that given the vast quantity of churches in Rome, but each one has it's one unique character, dedications and history. Beware though - the picpockets abound around this one.
Nice church. Tis basilica is huge. There is great art and a nice little gift shop, however I think the nearby church of Santa prassede is much better.
Another beautiful church!. There is so much to see in Rome, but this is so close to the train station that you can't miss it!

beautiful. This church was very close to our hotel - we walked in and the statues and paintings take your breath away! I have some fabulous pictures from this church.
FYI - you must be covered modestly - if not, they have covers you can borrow.

Beautiful. Like so many churches in Rome this one is lovely. Our visit was brief because there was a service in progress, but it is a magnificent building, luxuriously and beautifully decorated. Don't miss it.

The best and largest church dedicated to the Virgin Mary.. What a beautifull church inside.This is the largest and most spectacular of the ones I have visited.The golden mosaics are breathtaking and amongst the finest you will see.The Virgin Mary is said to have instructed Pope Liberius to build a church in the first place the snow fell and this is the result. Do visit by bus numbers 70,71 or 75.
Simple outside, rich inside!. That´s what it is Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore. I liked a lot and I recommend!
A Hidden Gem. This is beautiful church. Be sure to go between Masses if you want to wander around. However the splendid mosaics are only illuminated during Mass so be sure to pop in to see them then.

The great church Santa Maria Maggiore. Outside the church look just like another church anywhere. But inside! After the renovation the church is just amazing! But the greatest impact did the atmosphere in the church. It was so nice just to sit down in silence and let the 'holy' feeling surround you.
Worth peaking in......Beautiful!. Absolutely beautiful basilica. Definitely worth peaking into.
A must see!. Amazing... I'm sure my mouth was agasp for most of the walk around the Basilica - a must see!

Beautiful Church. This was a beautiful ornate church with the interiors done uo in baroque style. Owned by Vatican this church has lovely murals, beaautiful gold ceiling , lovely mosaic flooring and extra ordinary paintings and statues. The altar is another masterpiece , you walk around in awe at the master craftsmanship.
Wonderfully moving. Loved visiting this place,it gave me goose bumps just being inside and was able to pray while there.

Breathtaking. This church is simply beautiful and we cannot understand why it is not on more websites. It is the home of the original Nativity scene, which can be found in the museum at the bottom of the church. In addition there is a stunning marble statue of a pope praying, must have been twenty feet tall. It is also a "working" church and we were lucky enough to see a full mass whilst visiting. Located near to the Termini metro.

Amazingly beautiful basilica. Favorite church in Rome. This church was simply fantastic. Beautiful artwork and amazing relics. Should be included if you are wanting to visit Rome's better churches. While not one of our very favorite churches in Rome, we do enjoy visits to Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore. The fascade is nice on both the front and back of this church and there is enough inside of interest, making this a worthy stop if you are in search of Rome's best churches during your visit. We like the large nave area, not for the ceiling, which is ornate but similar to what you can find elsewhere in Rome. We like the wall paintings that line the Nave near the roof. Unfortunately, our last visit was early in the morning before the sun was shining through well enough so the wall paintings were a bit difficult to see. We also like the facade at the back of the church with the many statues mounted at top, similar but on smaller scale to what you'll see at the San Giovanni at Laterno. Here you can also see very impressive 5th century nave mosaics. The Triumphal arch, in particular, is quite beautiful. However, our favorite area is the Cappella Sistina, where you find the beautiful marbled crypt area with the praying pope statue, looking over the Holy Crib relic encased just in front of the statue. This is a touching, beautiful and memorable scene you can take home with you after leaving Rome. In addition to visiting Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore, you should make the extra time to walk across the small piazza onto Via di Santa Prassede to visit the superb Santa Prassede church, one of our very favorites in Rome, just 2-3 minutes walk from Santa Maria Maggiore. Combined they make an excellent combination of churches in Rome. Overall, Santa Maria Maggiore is not one of our very favorite churches in Rome but its good enough to include on your 'to see' list if you visiting Rome with church visits on your mind.

Gorgeous Early Christian basilica. This church dates from the 5th century, before the fall of the Roman empire. It is an example of the churches built by the early Christians after their faith was recognized by the emperor Constantine in the 4th century. The layout, with its tall nave(central aisle) and side aisles, and the clerestory windows rising above the side aisles, and the semicircular apse at the altar end, would become the basic format used by Christian churches in the west for close to 1500 years.  The mosaics near the altar and around the windows and on the nave walls are all original to the 5th century. The more flamboyant decorations=== frescoes and ornate sculpture---are later additions, mostly from the baroque period (17th century) Well worth a visit. The size of these early churches is impressive. In visiting this church, you can get a sense of what old St. Peters basilica looked like before Pope Julius II tore it down to start building what is the St. Peters we see today.

We saw new priests being ordained - nice!. We were in Rome in 2004, but did not go to many of the churches other than Saint Peter's Basilica. This church was a must-see on our list for this trip. The reason we wanted to see it was that the famous architect Bernini is buried there. This church is one of 7 pilgrimage basilicas in the world & was founded in 432 AD. We heard the bells ringing & decided to go see what was going on. To our surprise 4 new priests were being ordained. We watched the whole ceremony. The new priests had to lie prone face down on the floor for quite some time, then they each went over to the Cardinal & words were spoken & they kissed his ring. Then near the end of the ceremony each of the new priests were presented with their new vestments by fellow priests who helped them put them on. Very moving. We are so glad we got there in time to observe this sacred event. Unfortunately, my camera battery had died & I did not get any pictures. This is a really beautiful & special church.Nearby is the Church of Santa Prassede which has some very nice mosaics. Be aware that they close this church at lunch time.
